text: Great rooftop view paired with amazing food! Definitely one of my favorite go-to spots in Charlotte!
There is a rooftop area and often a crowd, so you should check it out for drinks. The food is OK but nothing special.

I like a lot of things about this place. I mostly come here to watch football with a group. They have a ton of tvs. The food is pretty good too for bar food. The giant soft pretzel is great but the cheese it comes with isn't so great. The Whiskey poppers are awesome. 
They have an OK selection of local beers. Wish they had more. The upstairs outside patio is really great in the summer time. Good size bar with tvs and areas around the bar to hang out. 
One thing I hate about this place is their policy for taking reservations on football Sunday. It's pretty ridiculous. They won't take a reservation for noon or later. So if I want to reserve a table for 6 I have to have everyone there at like 11:45 to get a reservation. That really makes zero sense. Why can't I reserve the table at 1:00? Or even 12:30. I don't get it.

Won't be going back to whiskey warehouse...

Where do I begin? This is the second negative experience I have had and what is worse than that is the managers response on both occasions.

The first experience was me asking for more butter with my meal. When I received my bill there was a charge for extra butter.  When asking the manager why I was charged he said he was new and it was "company policy".
Really, to charge for butter?? Should I ask before asking for more ice, salt/pepper???


The second time I was there ordering dinner again and decided on an entree. When ordering I ask if I could do a different side (something other than what the entree came with) she said sure what would you like? So I sub'd the rice and kale seed mix for a house salad and Mac n cheese. 
The salad arrived first and was not cold - more room temp which is not the way I prefer a salad but waited on the entree to arrive hoping it would be better. 
The food was "ok" bar food and nothing to give a raving review on. Just "ok".

I get the bill and was shocked again to see (sub house salad $3 - sub Mac n cheese $2. 
I ask the bar staff and was told "yeah it's on the menu, do you want a manager?"
Yes that would be great!

He shows up with an attitude from the beginning saying "it's company policy" and "it's on the menu".
I ask - Why wouldn't a server mention this?
"It's on the menu". 

I said this is the second bad experience have had here with feeling like 1) if there is an up charge please do me the courtesy of telling me AND most importantly I have NEVER been treated this way by two different restaurant managers from the same location in such a negative way. 

No - "I'm sorry. Let me take care of this for you this time but please be aware of the up-charges going forward." Nothing!! 

I guess it's "company policy" to not be nice and courteous to the customer here. I will not be returning ever bc of the managers attitude and the "company policies" that Whiskey Warehouse has.
Good luck!

This place became the new hot spot in Charlotte. On weeknights you will find a very chill crowd with not a lot of crazies out. You can enjoy a beer with friends, have some dinner, and go home happy and buzzed. Weekends, however, have turned into some what of a Charlotte nightlife nightmare. What was supposed to be (I am assuming) a chill atmosphere quickly turns into something you would find at Black Finn (without the dancing). If you're into that sort of stuff (which I am) then it's great, but if you're not, I think you'd be better off going to Thomas Street, which has a less crowded scene.

I really want to like this place. Great atmosphere...love the upper deck. The appetizers are good. I highly  recommend the Buffalo Chicken Dip. However, do not expect quick, attentive service. It isn't happening. Also, I ordered the special, sirloin steak, medium rare and got medium well. I'll try this place again because I want to like it but it maybe a place you just settle for drinks & apps.

Let me be clear from the outset, the food is not great. The Barballo chicken wings are the best thing on the menu... That said, we love this place. Only go to the "Top Shelf" deck and generally from the outside stairs. The deck and the staff have a nice buzz..... and so do I after the 1/2 off wine on thursday. The deck is head and shoulders above ( literally and figuratively)  everything else in Midwood. service comes with genuine smiles, and they actually know what they are doing. Great deck, veiw, people watching....enjoy

Looking for a cool spot to socialize, eat amazing food, and enjoy a great beverage? Whiskey Warehouse has it all. Yes, it is a bar with bar food, but it's the best bar and food off of Plaza. TV's float the room in the downstairs area with an old pub feel. Im not a whiskey drinking, but they are known for their whiskey liquor selection; Hence the name, "Whiskey Warehouse." On nice days in Charlotte the patio upstairs is open with a full bar and TV's which over looks downtown Charlotte. Love the atmosphere and the food. I don't think I have ever eaten anything bad on their menu. My boyfriend and I always tend to go to Whiskey when we are in that undecided mood because we never know what we want to eat, like any relationship. On Sundays they have a Bloody Mary bar which is awesome! Grab a shot from the bar and mix your own drink! How cool is that? I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a fun, cool spot!
Chealsea was our server. She was amazing and funny too. Always made sure we were good to go as well as attending to everyone else. It was crazy busy but she never showed anything but a smile.

I'm going to start this off by saying - to be fair, I came here after an event that was partially sponsored by this place, therefore it was SUPER busy. And from what I experienced, there wasn't a ton of parking, which is always annoying.

Because it was super busy - our service was pretty terrible & I feel like they could have prepared better, knowing there would be a rush of people coming in. I think on a more "regular" night, the service might be better & I'll for sure give them a second chance.

After waiting over an hour for my food (a salad), the order was wrong (I asked for two things to be removed & they were not) and the food was just sub-par.

One really GREAT thing about Whiskey Warehouse is their roofdeck...amazing view of the Charlotte Skyline! I plan to go back some night this summer & give them a second chance & enjoy the rooftop scenery!
Everything appeared wonderful until I bit into a piece of cardboard, and my night began to spiral down hill :(

Not impressed. Food was alright but do not go here on game day to eat and drink. Took almost two hours to get 1 salad, a burger, and waffles and chicken. When asked what was going on, we were told it is busy and they have a small kitchen. Food then came out cold, to which we were told they had been really backed up. I understand things busy but mgmt should anticipate a crowd on game days and be ready to provide service in a decent time frame, not lame excuses.

If you go, get their wings. My favorite are the Barballo (spelling?). Some of my favorite I've had around town. Their salads are pretty good as well. Sweet potato fries hit the spot. Veggies burger is very run of the mill however. Wait staff are always really nice and easy going. Food takes a LONG time to come out of the kitchen.

I love whiskey warehouse it's a nice change of pace for plaza Midwood. I generally really like the crowd that comes... The food is great, the waitresses are super friendly and the drink prices are awesome. The only reason for the four stars is the parking is really terrible!

I have to admit that I was skeptical when Whiskey Warehouse opened in the neighborhood where I live and work. I expected it to be a typical redneck sports bar kind of place full of obnoxious drunk people.

However, being that it's across the street from my office, it was so convenient that I really couldn't avoid checking it out. I ventured in a few times with friends for drinks and appetizers, and I never had a bad experience. (Well, okay, once the service wasn't fantastic in the upstairs "Top Shelf" roof bar.)

Last night, I was there for dinner with a companion for the first time. The service was very friendly, but they were out of the first bottle of wine we ordered, and then it took forever to get our meal. We weren't really in a hurry, so it wasn't a big deal, and when dinner came (tender, juicy ribs, perfectly seasoned cole slow, and crisp, delicious sweet potato fries) it was quite wonderful.

Here's the stunner. Even though we hadn't complained about the wait at all, our server notified the manager, Johnnalyn, of the situation, and she came right over to our table to apologize (explaining about the small kitchen size) and offer us a gift card for our next meal. Then came the bigger stunner. When our tab arrived, we had not been charged for our meal.

So here's why five stars. This is a restaurant that could get away with mediocre food and service, but instead delivers on both ends...including local food offerings (which I always appreciate) and the most professional and courteous management I've seen in a long time.

Bartenders are super nice here, Great roof top views, Good food at a reasonable price, They always ask your name and tell you theirs, They then remember your name throughout your whole visit!

Oh did I mention they have Whiskey, and they pour heavy!  We just moved to Charlotte, we've been here 3 times already, we think it's our new spot for sure!

Went to whiskey warehouse after reading reviews and guess what....
We waited an hour for food after asking 3 times.  We also had to ask for drinks more than once.
The manager said it was being plated. He brought it up and it was cold.  All of our meals were cold.  The manager offered to replace but we were starving so we ate the meat.  He said he would comp or table tonight then tried to  charge us for drinks we ordered while waiting.  We were appalled when he came to the table and said "your going to tell me what your doing with your meal"  He then threw his hand up and said get out of here.  When we asked his name he followed us to the door saying his name.
I have never been treated so disrespectful in my life.

I read the reviews before hitting up Whiskey Warehouse and wasn't entirely sure what to expect.  On the one hand, a place that purports to specialize in bourbons and whiskeys and conveniently has a vegetarian menu; on the other hand, reports of a sports bar vibe and a fratty clientele.  Hm.

Still, my brother is a big bourbon drinker and wanted to give it a try.  We rolled in around 8:30 on a Saturday night and were able to snatch a booth with a good view of the USC/Florida game.  Our server was perky and did her best to be helpful but admitted she wasn't much of a bourbon drinker.  She was, however, chatty and amply cleavaged, and given the crowd, the noise, and the TVs, seemed to be appropriate for the type of clientele WW apparently wants to service.  (And, yes, it's true - the clientele was decidedly frat-tastic.)

What I really wanted from WW was a dark, more intimate, saloony-style place, perhaps with servers who actually knew what they were serving and with management who cared more about the whiskey than about the game.  Unfortunately, Whiskey Warehouse is just another generic sports bar dressed up as a concept bar.  Meh.
Go to spot in Plaza. Upbeat vibes downstairs. Great Uptown view on the rooftop. And the best bartenders (Anna will hook you up!). Good game watching spot.
Fun music, good late night pretzel I didn't need, great crowd, service could be bettered by having more staff so the servers aren't rubbing around insane though. Overall really good atmosphere.

Me and my husband came here for the first time a few days ago, and it was a pleasant experience. 
We sat on the rooftop (it's a good view but it is a little bit obstructed by trees). It was a hot day, but they had fans out there that kept us cool.
The service was good, and the food was awesome. I only give it 4 stars due to it being really slow - which we normally don't mind, but it wasn't busy at all and it took 15 minutes for me to get my Bloody Mary. 
But other than that, our experience was great. I recommend getting the chicken nachos, and definitely try their Mac & Cheese - It's worth the $2 extra dollars.

While visiting a friend last week in Charlotte we decided to get a drink and some food at Whiskey Warehouse!  I would call it a mid to high end sports bar/restaurant.  It has a really great rooftop bar that has heat lamps, umbrellas and a ton of huge screens for watching any popular sports game (some might like that more than me).  

The bartenders were very nice and super efficient.  The food on the other hand took forever!  They did warn us that it would take 30 minutes for food but it took closer to an hour.  It was fine, just gave us more time to drink booze but I don't know if I would go back to eat, maybe just get a drink.  Great view of downtown too!
Excellent wings and an absolutely gorgeous upstairs outdoor patio that has an amazing view of the city.
The best chicken nachos ever! Everything was so fresh! Comes with sour cream & salsa!!! Great customer service too!

Whiskey Warehouse has a gorgeous interior, a great concept, but terrible food and service, and management that just doesn't seem to care. I went in with a group of friends for lunch at 11am on a Saturday- we were the only customers in the place. It took over an hour for us to receive our food. At least 12 people who came in after us (and two who even came in after we ordered) received their food before we did. Despite numerous inquiries, we didn't even get an apology out of the server or management. I'd eaten there once before and the shrimp kabob had been pretty decent, but the turkey burger several of us got was dry and tasteless, and they served me a side of chopped onions and peppers as the "vegetable of the day". Onions and peppers are what you cook vegetables in! Others in our party received their food cold, ironic after how long we waited. There are just too many good restaurants in the area for me to EVER go back there again. Sticking with Thomas St Tavern from now on!

The food sounded pretty good, but we never found out. We sat, ignored, for about 20 minutes before walking out. 

We sat on the upstairs patio and were summarily ignored after being handed menus. The only attention we received was when we finally started walking back down the stairs, hungry and parched. But too little, too late. There are plenty of great restaurants in the neighborhood (with great service), don't waste your time here.
Been there a few times. Great bar, and the food is really good - especially the mac-n-cheese!
I'm sitting here trying to figure out how old the French fries are that are supposed to be the base of this "pouting"...  and I'm guessing they're pretty old.  I'll let them know when/if they ask.

I've lived in the area for three years and just recently discovered this place.  I love the rooftop bar and my boyfriend likes the cool mist of water they spray out on customers when it's hot out (don't worry you won't get wet).

I've never had a bad meal or bad service, no matter how busy the place gets. I can't say that about many restaurants in Charlotte.  They do get packed on Friday and Saturday nights but as long as you don't mind fighting for tables or bar space you'll still enjoy.
Fish & Chips was good.  Decent menu selection, decent prices.

I've been here multiple times for drinks with friends and always had decent service - not good, just ok. Finally tried their wings because I've always heard how great they are, and I was so disappointed! The flavors were fine, but the wings were soggy and flabby. I ate a few of them and didn't even bother to take the rest home.

I know, I know; "Good menu selection" or "Holy cow, amazing" may not necessarily be the first thoughts that pop into mind when you think of Whisky Warehouse. But to my wonderful surprise, there's far more stacking up in this kitchen window than just good 'ol Jim Beam.

 I'm so pleased to say that its name actually doesn't do this joint a bit of justice; aside from an awesome bar scene, dining area and fabulous upstairs patio, the food is the real "worker" of this warehouse.

With everything on its expansive menu from traditional Carolina classics like pulled pork and chicken dishes smothered in sweet, honey-glazed BBQ sauce, to popular appetizers like the,Whiskey handmade Pimento cheese poppers, hand battered and fried to perfection, all the way to the Creme Brie Chicken, a unique sandwich topped with cinnamon-grilled pineapple, maple syrup, Brie and candied walnuts,(um, yum) Whisky Warehouse is a Plaza Midwood "hit."

And as if that wasnt enough of a well-rounded selection to tempt even the pickiest of eaters, they take it even one step further by offering an assortment of awesome vegetarian dishes. Who wouldn't love the Commonwealth Pasta made of whole wheat noodles, veggies and Parmesan tossed in a light, creamy sauce? Literally, whatever you're hungry for, you can find.

However, the dish that takes this cake and gets all of my thanks and praises has to be the "Elvis;" a burger even the King himself would be proud of. Served with lettuce, tomato and home cut Whisky fries, this monster patty is stacked with American cheese, bacon and PEANUT BUTTER.
 Yes, you read that right; the crazy combination of the juice from the burger, mixed with the creaminess of the melted cheese and saltiness from the bacon and PB, it's a combination that can only be deemed "genius". Well done, Chef Sam. 

Be sure and check this spot out the next time Happy Hour rolls around, the family is in town visiting or for another perfect sunny Charlotte day on the patio. The bartenders, servers and managers have been nothing but as friendly and attentive as they could be. What more could you possibly want in a restaurant? They're the real deal, y'all.

WHISKY WAREHOUSE!! Hard to beat!

If you've ever had salmon, I promise that the "Bourbon Butter Salmon Served with rice and vegetables at $13.00 will be the best salmon you've eaten at any price.  If you've never had salmon, once you try this dish, you'll be hooked.

I took a buddy there today and He had the Salmon on a mixed green salad.  His reaction was "this is way too delicious to be healthy".

No lie, I've had this dish on at least 10 different ocassions.  It gets better every time. 

Oh! almost forgot, the Mack & Cheese (what??) and the Chicken Fingers that I got for my daughter are apt for a kid any size.  It was really "yumi" to quote her.  But mommy ate half. 

Don't forget to give props to SAM the chef on the way out.
This place is great.  Awesome staff, great specials and solid bar food.  One of the best spots to grab a drink and watch a game.

My  husband and I decided to come here last Sunday, since we heard the upstairs roof patio was awesome.......it definitely did not let down!!!

What an incredible view of the city! There are tv's all around the bar so you can watch a game and just enjoy the weather. 

I ordered the mimosa ($2 on Sunday or $4 for a doube.....of course you have to get the double) and my husband ordered an OMB beer. They didnt have a ton of draft selections up there, but I am assuming their selection downstairs was larger. Nice champagne to OJ (aka 2/3 champagne) pour! I also ordered the chorizo sandwich with sweet potato fries. It had a fried egg and jack cheese on top. Very good!

It was fairly busy but we were able to find two seats at the bar. Will absolutely return!

Two things I absolutely love in this world: whiskey and rooftop patios. Clearly, I was destined to end up at Whiskey Warehouse at some point during my Charlotte visit. 

The rooftop has a great environment and view, service isn't bad, and the drinks are abundant, especially those pitchers! Any of them with whiskey were my favorites, but I probably don't need to tell you that twice. Great to share with a few friends and really just enjoying a beautiful spring night in Charlotte. 

As with most rooftop patios, it got packed really quickly here (and probably does on most nights) so be ready to wait for a table to open up.

Really enjoy this place for football. The TVs and sound system are fantastic and there isn't a bad seat in the house. The food is great and reasonably priced too. I really enjoy the wing flavors i tried, but they could be a little spicier and saucier for me, but thats just how i like my wangz, y'allI. I tried the buffalo and the habanero mango flavors, both were delicious. Service is fantastic and the servers are very easy on the eyes. I love tights and yoga pants!

Well, after 10 minutes of waiting at the bar for the bartender to acknowledge my existence, I decided to leave.  She was talking to one guy the whole time, there were 5-6 people sitting at the bar---she wasn't swamped.
Wonderful burgers!! Friends got the wings and really enjoyed them as well. They also have great fries. Every time I've been, service has been good. Nice low key place with good food.
It's TOO LOUD TO THINK! This place would be better if you could have a conversation without yelling.

On Monday of the holiday weekend, we visited Whiskey Warehouse in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood of Charlotte. This rustic looking pub has an industrial feel built into a sports bar with many TV's and a large rooftop patio. 

We started with the Brussel sprouts appetizer, cooked in a white wine, garlic and parmesan reduction topped with bacon jelly. We are really not sprouts fans, but we gave them a try and were not disappointed. They were roasted, smoky and the bacon jelly could easily get addictive. Dora here. Still not a sprouts fan, but this appetizer is a great way to entice kids, er...adults to eat their veggies. That bacon's like candy!

Since May was National Burger Month, we ordered burgers. I selected the Elvis Burger, topped with peanut butter, bacon and cheese. Now I am a peanut butter lover but have never thought about adding it to a burger but will in the future. This burger was large, juicy, and tasted great. You could taste the peanut butter, but it was not overwhelming and blended together perfectly.

Dora here. Based on our friendly server's recommendation, I ordered the Bistro Burger, topped with caramelized onions, Brie cheese, bacon and a horseradish dijon aioli. Oh my stars! This juicy burger wowed me with robust flavor, the sweetness from the Brie and onions calling out for more bites until all I had left was an empty plate. The hand-cut fries were a perfect accompaniment, and finally, a restaurant that passed my iced tea test with an A+! Adding Whiskey Warehouse to our "must return" list.

I would rate this establishment 5 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving outstanding food.
Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog

I had my doubts about this place from the beginning, but since it was suggested by another person in our fairly large party, I decided not to be difficult and go. 

We arrived at 8:30 on a Friday night. The wait was OK considering we had 9 in our group. They do have a cozy waiting section in the corner, filled with plush couches and chairs, however it's not a very intimate spot. The music was so loud and the couches were so far apart everyone in the group ended up shouting across the space just to have a conversation. 

The wait staff, hostesses and bartenders we all very friendly and quick to offer up something to drink. The food was ... OK. Not the worst I've had, but certainly not the best. I got the grilled cheese - it was as expected. The fries were very good. Two friends got burgers, who said they were decent, and another two friends got the steak kabobs, which received mediocre reviews. 

The other patrons weren't quite as fratty as I was expecting from reading previous reviews on here, but I can see where they were going with it. No Affliction or Ed Hardy tees in sight ...
Cool vibe, especially on their rooftop. Food was a little disappointing with no flavor. Monday's happy hour wing special is a good deal!

So this was my first time here , we walked in saw a giant cockroach on the stairs. Went up to the patio to eat and drink , halfway through our meal we saw another giant cockroach ON OUR FOOD. Then we saw two more under our chairs. We first spoke to the waitress and she told us that it's normal because we are outside. We then asked for the manager and he also told us it was normal and there's nothing they can do about it because we were outside. They only discounted $5 off of our $60 dollar tab that we didn't finish because we were disgusted. After we paid our waitress simply told us to "have a good one" and walked away. We are still disgusted since we saw a total of 6 cockroaches one of them being literally in our boneless wing. DONT EAT HERE.

Stopped in here randomly while exploring Plaza Midwood.  Parking is around back, but fills up quickly.  Good drink selections, menu is simple and concise, and the Chicken Pasta was absolutely incredible! Highly recommended!

With the name Whiskey Warehouse, I wasn't sure what to expect. But who cares b/c I loved it! The inside is a huge area full of tables along with a little lounge area with cushy seats and ottomans plus tv's everywhere you look. The service was great plus you can't beat beers for $2 and $3 along with a selection of pretty much every whiskey or scotch under the sun. They have a dj playing current tunes along with the early 90's jams that we all love so. Oddly enough, it seemed louder outside than inside but oh well, it was a great time.  Parking is a bit scarce in their lot but you can always look at the lots off Thomas Street and off street parking or keep an eye out for the cabs strolling by there every five minutes---lifesavers I tell you.  I will be back here for sure.
Came here with Friends for Drinks and Food. The Wings were decent. Defiantly more of a causal environment and laid back feel.

Love this place. Ask for Martha behind the bar! Sometimes they're a little slow on sundays for brunch especially upstairs, but they managers are very accommodating for any troubles. One of the best views of the city! Perfect summer hangout spot! $4 jack specials are always a reason to come back! This place is a second home!

the current reviews back up my review I did over a year ago....in a neighborhood w/as many great bars as P-Wood has, WHY would anyone bother coming here?...although as it IS a landing point for every poser-ey douchebag & pretty person in a 10 mile radius, maybe we SHOULD encourage its existence so they can all flock here and stay out of the good bars in the area...so if you're reading this and from the 28210-28211-28207 zip code, WW is the greatest bar ever invented by man or God.....
This place gets 5 stars from me. We have been here 3 times this year and each time it has been great, great atmosphere to celebrate my hubbys bday. Great servers and drinks too

My husband and I are Bourbon enthusiasts, and we have wanted to check out this place for a long time. We were in the area on Saturday and finally took the opportunity to check this one off our list. We started our order with a Jefferson flight that included Jefferson Small Batch, Jefferson Reserve, and Jefferson Ocean.  It was $17.  I've been curious about Jefferson Ocean, but never wanted to fork over $100 for a whole bottle without tasting it first.  IMHO, bourbon doesn't have to cost a small fortune to be great.  I'm glad I waited because I preferred the taste of the Small Batch best. We also ordered a Jack & Coke, which were on special for $4.  It was a perfectly balanced cocktail.  The coke was sweet, and the Jack wasn't watered down or too strong.  (You would think it would be simple enough to never get wrong, but many bars do.). In case you aren't a whiskey fan, they also had double Mimosas and Bloody Mary's on special for $5. 

I ordered the BBQ pork plate. The meat was moist and seasoned well. It does have some heat to it, but not so much that it overpowered the taste of the pork.  I didn't try the slaw, but it was well presented and looked good. I substituted Mac-n-cheese for fries, and they came out hot and crispy.  My hubby ordered the fish and chips, and he was also very happy with his food.  He said the fish was moist and well seasoned. 

What really impressed us about this place was the exception customer service we received. Our server patiently answered our questions and checked back frequently to make sure we had everything we needed. It was a very pleasant experience and we will definitely go back for the Saturday specials!

We visited the Whiskey Warehouse for the first time this past Sunday night.  Parking wasn't ideal (or well-defined), but we found a spot (or made our own).  Upon entering, we were impressed by the look, atmosphere, and wide-open space of the restaurant.  It was very inviting, fun, and alive with energy.  Our server was great, too, and she reminded me a bit of Rachael Ray -- both in her smile and her voice.  

We got a great booth on the side of the restaurant (although I would have also have been happy at one of their several high-tops.)  I ordered a Bratwurst Sandwich from the "Local Food Section" of the menu.  For $1 extra, I substituted sweet potato fries for regular.  The bratwurst was delicious, topped with grilled onions and peppers, and so full of flavor.  It was just the right size, too, so I didn't feel overstuffed.  My partner on the other hand ordered the Southern Chicken sandwich -- a fried chicken breast with pimento cheese and bacon.  It was freakin' HUGE and a damn good value.  He couldn't even finish it all.  The sweet potato fries were delicious, too!

I also enjoyed watching the drunk sports fanatic at the table next to us who moved in very slow motion and tried to hold his head up the whole time we were there.  He was quite entertaining. 

Lastly, if you're into whiskey (unfortunately, I'm not), they have a fantastic selection of brands for you to try.   

We'll definitely return for a fun, casual night out.  I'd love to try their upstairs, outdoor seating/bar when it warms up again.

Solid neighborhood place to chill with friends or grab a good meal. I'm particularly fond of Sunday's when the bloody mary bar is set up. They've got a lot of TV's set up and play some good music. And ladies...it doesn't have a feel of a sports bar, so no worries there. 

I've had the fish & chips here a few times and it's my go to meal. Not the best I've ever had, but let's be honest...it's fried fish and fried potatoes...score!

I went there on a friday night with a couple friends and we had some drinks and dinner. I agree that this place pretty much seems outta place with its location and some of the douche bags it appears to draw. Maybe they will draw a better customers in the future but as long as the crowd they have now is spending, then management is probably perfectly ok with them. 

I had the salmon which was delicious and we all shared the nachos app which was pretty spicy but also delicious. I found the beer selection to be moderately priced, maybe leaning a little towards  expensive. I didn't bother with the whiskey menu as that stuff pretty much turns me into a raging asshole. The decor of the place was cozy and it seemed to be laid out fairly well. However, the parking there sucks and we were lucky to get a spot. I'd probably give this place 4 stars but for the time being the frat boy customers look like they've all just graduated from Buckhead Saloon downtown and brought their doucheness to a new venue for display. Go check it out if you've got a chance. I probably wouldn't recommend being a regular though.

I've been wanting to try WW for years simply based on the looks of this place. The rooftop patio looks awesome from below and I think it has a view of the great Charlotte skyline. Anyway, I finally found a Saturday to grab lunch there with a friend, and in short, I look forward to my next visit. I ate in this building about 7-8 years ago when it was another restaurant (can't remember the name). The renovation changeover blew me away. I love what they did!! Very rustic and well done with plenty of seating options. It was a tad too cool to eat on the rooftop this day so that will be my next visit. Ok, onto the service and food. The place wasn't that packed so we got a table immediately. The waitress was very nice and we didn't wait long at all to have our orders taken. We each ordered cheeseburgers with fries. Fresh cut fries that is. Anyone that knows me will know hands down that good french fries will get me back for a second visit. WW has those fries. Seasoned just right and fresh tasting. The burgers were very good also even though the meat was a tad dry on mine. The only minor complaint I have was that it took almost a half hour to get our food after we ordered. The waitress kept telling us it would be soon. I definitely won't hold this against them. Even a well run restaurant has a difficult day now and then. Even then, I am usually not in a great hurry on Saturdays so it was ok with me. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

Oh Sunday Football!! Only to be made better by the Bloody Mary bar and cheep Mimosa's oh and $2 Bud lights!! They have a map of the floor chart that shows what TV's will be showing what game so you could pick your area out. I thought that was pretty cool considering they have TVs everywhere!! It was fun and close to home!

Came to have a late lunch during the Panthers game and was disappointed by the poor service.  I know to expect slow service here based on my prior experiences, but today was worse than ever.  First off we were sat and our server didn't come over for over 5 minutes.  We ordered an appetizer of wings with our drinks.  When the server came back with our drinks we ordered our meal.  A while later, we still don't have wings and I see out food just sitting in the window and other servers/the manager just looking at it waiting for our server to come over- ever heard of teamwork? Then our wings come out about 5 min later by the manager who asked if they were supposed to be an app.  When we said yes, he said "oh" with no apology or anything.  Also, most of the time we were here he was standing in the corner talking to the group of servers or texting.  Didn't really seem him working.  The food here is good, but don't expect good service.

i can not give a full review on whiskey but from what i had, the good looking waitresses and the atmosphere it makes me want to go back.i did not try any food on my visit. i did like the atmosphere and music being played and its a great place if you like bourbon and whiskey which i do.

Love the rooftop bar. Went inside to eat, took almost an hour to get food and the salmon and fries were cold. Something isn't right here, potential, but need some intervention. Won't be back and won't recommend.

Classic bar food with plenty of tvs for watching. 

We stopped in on a Saturday evening. There was no wait and our food came out quickly. My companions both had the house burger that they were satisfied with. I had the deep fried pimento cheese balls that were listed as homemade, but anytime something comes out in a uniform perfect shape all the way across that statement loses a little bit of credibility. I am talking perfect circle here. That didn't stop me from enjoying them though, they were basically pimento mozzarella sticks and they were great. 

Our waitress was very nice, and everything was reasonably priced. If I were looking for a quick bite to eat in the area or trying to catch a game on I would definitely check it out again.

Update went back with family this weekend and the burger was MASSIVE and delicious!

I have to be honest....I came in here with pretty low expectations. With a name reminiscent of trashy college bars - I expected a lot less. It's actually like a classy version of a sports bar. We came at six on Friday for dinner after work. It has a great "chill out" atmosphere with great music. Also, a ton of tvs, extensive whiskey selection, and good service. The buffalo chicken dip was awesome. The wings were fall off the bone juicy, but the brisket was flat, dry, and overcooked. It did have really good flavor though.

Don't believe the hype!!! My wife and I stopped in with a few friends for some food and drinks, and the first impressions of this place is good. But that's as good as it gets. The only goal of this establishment is to take your money and in return you receive bad service. They blatantly over serve alcohol to a lot of patrons. But it gets worse, when we were able to finally submit a food order it was taken in a very unprofessional manner. Then the entrees were brought out before our appetizer, I tried to speak to the waitress about it but her response was to roll her eyes and walk off. So I requested to speak to the manager. When the manager arrived he already was very defensive and was in a foul mood. I asked him why our food came out in the order it did and his response was " be happy you got your food!!" At that point I explained to him that is not how you treat customers and that we are leaving, his response was just walking off! So as you can see don't waste your valuable time and money.

Usually I love Whiskey Warehouse but recently the food hasn't been the greatest. Ordered something and was told it'd be about 15 minutes. Waited at the bar almost 30 minutes to get my food. I got all the way home when I realized it was completely messed up.... when it's all I've wanted all day long. Not worth the time to go back, especially when it's so late and I'm exhausted from working all day. Prepare for subpar service if you go here.

This place is 5 stars in my book.  Always a decent drink special, good bar food, plenty of TVs, and an awesome rooftop bar with a nice view of Uptown.  The service has always been good too.  Whiskey is always an option when we're out and about in Midwood looking for a drink.
Sit upstairs on the patio during nice weather and enjoy the view and wings!  Ribs are great too.
Waitresses got GREAT tits. Service slow AF doe! But them titties bouncing almost makes up for it.

You really have to know what time and day to visit a particular venue in Charlotte, especially one like this which at any given moment can be a family restaurant, a sports bar or a pickup joint.  

When it's not full of yahoos, it's a really nice place from my experience today.  I got the Warehouse Burger and wasn't crazy about the BBQ sauce which tasted more like wing sauce (tart 'n spicy instead of rich 'n smoky).  But it was perfectly cooked and the bacon was crisp and tasty.  The waitress was attentive and knowledgeable.  And most importantly, true to their name, they have an obvious, albeit expensive selection of bourbon, whiskey and whisky that covers all the bases.

I'd give them four stars if they got rid of all the flat screen TV's and were in a location more suitable to the clientele that enjoys eating and drinking what's on their menu.  If we're lucky, when something else trendy and new opens up in PM, WW will mature into a really great spot.  Time will tell, so stay thirsty my friends...

Whiskey Warehouse is a great drinking spot, especially for day drinking. They have the best rooftop patio in the city. Unfortunately, it is the best rooftop in the city so get there at opening time or be prepared to sit inside/stand around waiting to steal a seat as it is first come first served. 

I came here to eat last week for the first time. I usually only go here for the drinks. There was a wait but we eventually got sat. They informed us that they were giving us the new menu but they hadn't actually started serving the new menu so we should ask our server about something if we were interested. Thought that was weird... Why not just wait to put out the new menus?

They were out of a few of the beers we wanted. Ended up getting a pretty good one I had never had before. I got a steak wedge salad medium rare and it came out the steak was cold. Not just room temp but cold. Everyone else at the table had gotten something fried so my guess is that mine sat out for awhile. I hate complaining but couldn't eat it so let me server know. They must've microwaved it and brought it right back out and it was well done. I was pretty shocked they would do that. I asked for more steak and finally got it right. Chewy steak though not worth getting. 

My server was great. The food wasn't so great.
Every Thursday is prime rib night. Fantastic price and good quality.  Queen cut around $12 and King's cut 14. Great rooftop bar over looking the CLT

I stopped by their space on Saturday evening at the Brewer's Ball  for the Cystic Fibrosis foundation. They brought some sort of ribs as well as  Pimento cheese with corn chips.  Of course, since I don't partake in beef or pork, I passed on the ribs. But, I sampled their pimento cheese with chips.  It was made the way I like it, meaning its really cheesy, you can't really detect the mayo, and it had a slight kick.

Great brunch spot! I'm a huge pimento cheese fan, and the whiskey poppers (fried balls of pimento cheese) were everything! Service was excellent, and the prices are very reasonable. We did not eat on the rooftop patio due to ridiculously hot weather, but we did check it out and it looks awesome for a summer night! I would definitely recommend this restaurant!
Great Wings and Great Drinks! Roof top service is on point. My regular Monday night stop!

We really like the rooftop bar here. In a strange kind of way, they have different beer selections upstairs and downstairs, so you might have to go up and down. While we loved the open air rooftop, the downstairs is rather dark and dingy during the day.

It's a shame this place is getting such poor reviews.  I had a great experience here last Thurs. night the staff was more than friendly and how can you beat half priced wine by the glass or bottlev-that will bring me back any night.

I enjoyed the atmosphere and my whiskey shots.  I think this is a great place to bring a group for some cocktails.   This place has a lot of potential can't wait to come back and check out the menu and some more whiskey.
Absolutely fabulous service at Whisky Warehouse! GABBY is an amazing server and incredibly friendly. Make sure you ask for her!!
Extremely slow service. After waiting for almost 45 minutes for a burger we got our order to go.

We came here on a Friday for lunch and wanted to sit on the rooftop because the weather was beautiful. Unfortunately the rooftop isn't open durning the week until dinner time. Food is good but would have been nice to enjoy the nice weather and beautiful scenery the restaurant can but didn't offer.

Not much of a bar person as I find the noise level ridiculously loud and one ends up screaming to have a conversation, but to my friend's suggestion I decided to go anyway and chill. Well I was not surprised but what really turned me off were those awful things they served; the dreaded chicken wings. How can anyone "eff up" chicken wings. These were unsavory and the garlic Parmesan are not to be bothered with. Go for the social atmosphere and have a brew/pint but leave it to just that only.

My New Favorite Bar in Charlotte....

What's not to like about this spot? Whiskey Warehouse is the rare bar that perfectly mixes the concoction of bar, food, screens, service, patio-area/view and overall ambiance that make any bar worth going to.

Bar: Every time I've been here they have had some sort of beer special; from $2 bud lites, to $3 micro brews, to $4 Jack Daniels you-call-its.  R.B.V.s are also reasonably priced around $18 for two, which is more than straight.

Food:  I can honestly say this place has some of the best bar food anywhere in Charlotte - for real.  I have eaten here multiple times and everything I have had has been awesome.  I recently had the Monterrey Chicken Sandwich, which I can say was hands-down one of the best chicken sandwiches I have ever had - every sandwich should have pepper-jack cheese and guacamole!  I have also had the wings here on multiple occasions.  The wings always come well sauced, meaty, well cooked, and with a cold, thick ranch.  If you've read my other reviews, then you know how important it is to me that they char their wings.  That's right folks, the wings are thrown on a grill for a min before they bring them out to you.  I had the chance to eat brunch here last Sunday, and I have to stay I was thoroughly impressed.  The toast was a little undercooked, but otherwise the scrambled eggs and bacon were up to par.  

Screens: I love the fact that they have plenty of television screens littered and hanging from every corner of this bar.  Even when you go upstairs to the gorgeous rooftop patio, they have plenty of television screens embedded within the bar area.   

Patio/View: Speaking of the rooftop patio - @ WW you will find nothing short of the most SPECTACULAR and BREATHTAKING VIEW OF THE CHARLOTTE SKYLINE anywhere!  There is plenty of seating and they have full waitress and bar service.  I also appreciate the H20 mist they have cooling down the patrons at the bar.  Though BEWARE fellas, many ladies are leery of the mist interacting with their hair!

Service:  Great service.  My order has always been correct each time I've ordered food or drinks.   I am preferential to the bar staff simply because of easier access to drinks, and closer views of the television screens.  

I've tried to come up with something not to like about this place and I can't.  Prices are reasonable.  Though tight, they do indeed have a parking lot.  I meant what I said to start this review, I love Whiskey Warehouse, its my new favorite bar in Charlotte and I will def be back - hope to see you there!

PS: FYI: Monday WW has 1/2 price wings.  They serve brunch on Sunday's starting at 11am!  $3 bloody Mary's on SUNDAYS!!!

ROLL TIDE! I am a frequent customer her on Saturdays in the fall. There are always games on the tvs, drinks flowing, and great food being served. I live within walking distance and I always have a great time here. The Bloody Mary bar is the BEST in Charlotte and you can't beat their chicken and waffles. Burgers are good, lemon pepper wings are great! Service can be slow during busy times, which is expected but overall I always have a great experience. Plus their rooftop is amazing!! The views of the city are beautiful!

We stumbled upon this place thinking it looked like a nice place to spend our one warm evening of the month. It sucked. Waited 45+ mins for a drink and for some soggy fries and a terrible cold "chicken buffalo wrap" it was probably the worst food I've had since moving to Charlotte. The one saving grace was that the bartenders were cool and comped our food caused they realized how much it sucked.
Came here on Saturday, severely understaffed. I waited 20 minutes at the bar and doesn't even get a hello. Decided to go across the street and got prompt service.
great rooftop bar with nice views of Charlotte's skyline
Love this place. Can relax and have a couple beers while having quality food instead of the typical pub grease burgers.

We had a late lunch there today around 3pm. It was slow in the restaurant and the staff was all friendly and very chatty. Could've been somewhat faster service but it wasn't terribly slow. The buffalo chicken sandwich was good- the buffalo sauce was very peppery and delicious.

First let me say, I have never eaten here. I have visited multiple times for drinks and views in the evening and have been there once during the day for cocktails. The environment fits in with plaza with a typically prep pier leaning crowd for the area. I love the rooftop and the views it has. Limited parking is available on a pull through drive next to it. But is very very rare. Most visits I did not notice the staff or service meaning it was totally fine and not noteworthy. Sadly, this last visit, the staff was extremely disappointing. I went last Friday around 4pm. I sat on the roof with a dozen coworkers. Although there were 3-5 staff/bartenders at the bar the entire 2 hours we were there and around 4 other patrons, it's took 5-15 minutes to get any of their attention. They were standing within 6 feet of us and when we would come up to the bar, none of them would male eye contact. Eventually a blonde server would usually help us, reluctantly. She seemed very annoyed by all requests. 

I will continue to patron here for late nights but do not plan to hang out here when I'm looking to be treated nicely and timely.

The bartender Jess is a total bitch. After I was speaking to a patron who, according to Jess, comes in "everyday" and assumed I was harassing the patron. She threatened me with being kicked out for literally nothing. Look at her face and you will see that natural bitch look. Ugh. News flash Jess, you're not hot. Oh and you're in the service industry. No tip, no potential.

Been here many times and love the rooftop patio views! Came with some friends for the Alabama game and sat at the downstairs bar.  This experience was just ok - we were served beers in hot (fresh from the dryer) glasses which made them immediately warm :-/ The nachos were just alright and the buffalo wrap left a lot to be desired.  Great for a fun atmosphere with friends, but not the best food.

This is a bar you'll want to visit to watch a game. There are plenty of tv's. 

But, we all thought visit for the first half and get an appetizer. The nachos were a small plate for the price but were very good. 

Other meals are pricy and others were saying the meals weren't that great.

Lots of whiskey ... of course. Pretty extensive selection.

It was too cold to go to the rooftop area. But, we'll be back to check that aspect out and try some other appetizers.

I wanted to give this place a shot for brunch but it let me down. The wait was long and there were open tables just not being cleaned. The food took forever and came out burnt. The wait staff was very rude and did not seem to care about their customers that were dining. Very disappointed in the overall experience at this establishment.
Christy was very friendly! Got the cucumber mango mowscow mule for $11 and was well worth it and I'm a dive bar drinker lol

Love coming to this place to watch a game, and usually they have some pretty great drink specials. Super disappointed in the food lately. It used to be great, but then they changed the menu and everything seems cheap, poor presentation and they skimp on ingredients. Usually get the nachos and was extremely disappointed. Over 1/2 the chips had nothing on them. It was basically a a few pieces of chicken, tomatoes and some cheese. No salsa. No sour cream. No beans. And for $11! Could've gotten better nachos at Taco Bell for $1. Not sure I will be ordering food here anymore.

Warning: A Sunday funday could end up with you showing your ass to strangers. Not saying, just saying. 

I go here a bunch, no doubt. It is, in my mind, one of THE Charlotte Sunday spots. Beyond the Sundays, a nice view, good beer prices and food that is hit and miss for me. I definitely like it as a bar, just luke warm on the food.

Fantastic rooftop bar with a fantastic view of The Queen City. The seating on the rooftop bar is first come first seated. The servers are friendly. The atmosphere is always bussing with conversation and cocktails.

Food is a total disappointment here. You don't get the quality of food that you are paying for. This is a great place to come grab a drink. If the weather is good the top shelf rooftop bar has great views of Uptown.

Love this place. The atmosphere is freaking fabulous. And I am always surprisingly happy with the food. I didn't expect them to have such good food but they really do! Big portions, good salads, awesome apps. I love that they have $4 Jack every day I mean come on, just for that I'd go. The view is great. The staff is always great. We just love it! Maybe some more fans though it gets hot as hell up there!

You ever want to not review a place because you fear that other's will find out it's awesome? ... Yeah, I guess that's why I've been holding off on reviewing Whiskey Warehouse. Either that or I'm a procrastinator. Here's the top three reason why Whiskey Warehouse is favored so dearly by me:

1. Wings
The wings are some of the best "traditional" wings I've had in Charlotte and I've committed to finding good wings where ever I live. Wings over Everything! Wings (and ball) is Life! ... Anyway, there's a ton of good options in terms of sauce or dry rub. My top three choices are: Lemon Pepper, Parmesan Garlic and BBQ (tangy deliciousness). The wings are meaty and crispy and never disappoint. I usually go for all drums because all wing connoisseurs know the drums are the best.

2. Value / Happy Hour
Love wings but balling on a budget? ... 1/2 price apps Monday through Friday. All the wing goodness, half the price! I guess there's other apps to try but I would stress focusing on the wings. .. Love whiskey! Of course you do! What else would you down your wings with? ... Well my friend / stranger reading this review there's $4 Jack Daniels drinks just for you (or anybody else with $4). Can't go wrong there. There's tons of other great whiskey to pick from at a very reasonable price.  

3. Brunch on the Patio
Sunday brunch ... you, your friends, a couple of flights of Mimosas for $12 or $2 glasses, a good selection of yummy eats ranging from pancakes to burgers and wings of course. what more could you ask for? ... You: What about a nice view of the Uptown skyline? ... Whiskey Warehouse: I got you fam. ... The patio give you all of that. If it's nice out, it might take you a little bit to grab a really good spot.

Neat atmosphere like an old whiskey saloon inside.  But
the best part is the rooftop bar/eatery with a great city backdrop.  Food was slower than I prefer but to be expected anytime I dine outside.  I ordered the buffalo wrap which was great but the fries were cold.  They gladly accommodated me with new.  Overall I'd be back to eat on the rooftop with a city view.  Price point was affordable as well
Try the bloody mary bar!

If you like whiskey and bar food this place is perfect for you. Service is as expected for a bar scene, but the menu makes up for it. The warehouse offers a great selection of American style foods in addition to an adventurous brunch menu. I'd like to see them offer cheaper jack and cokes because they are $4 everywhere else. Trust me, I've traveled, and drank, plenty. Overall a great restaurant for all ages especially post college.

The wings are great, especially on 1/2 off Mondays. The rooftop bar is also great, the 2 flights of stairs help you work off the wings.  
Downside-on weekends they have a DJ and the music volume is VERY VERY loud.  This is a bar/restaurant and in trying to make it into a dance club, the Warehouse loses the appeal of lounge for conversing and sipping a fine drink.  We have to yell so loudly that the person in the next seat can hear pieces of a conversation. As a Speech-Language Pathologist, I can state that the combination of alcohol, yelling over loud music, and trying to hear over loud music causes damage to the vocal cords and hearing abilities.

i've been to this place a few times.  This place is always packed with people but i don't mind.

The thing that we usually get here are their pitchers.  If you come here with a group of friends, the pitcher is what i suggest you should get.  Its a great way to not spend a lot of money and still get your drank game on! The pitchers are relative cheap for the amount of alcohol content you get

This place is a great starter place to come to pregame and bar hop to the next place.
The environment is real chill and they serve some pretty good food that compliments the drinks here

I recommend getting the Jack and Coke pitcher as that is their most popular one.  Also the lemon drop one is pretty tasty too.

Very disappointed with my meal today. This is what I was served when I ordered garlic parmesan boneless wings.  When I asked my server if this how this dish normally comes out, she said yes. I can't believe they let this leave the kitchen.

Stopped in for drinks on Saturday afternoon and sat up on the rooftop at the bar. Didn't order food as we had just finished brunch and we're looking for a scenery change. Absolutely enjoyed everything. Had multiple drink specials, all the college games on and had great service with multiple bartenders working. The food looked and smelled good and would definitely try them out for a meal

Came here for dinner on a weeknight with a friend. We sat on the rooftop area which was amazing because it had a fantastic view. I wouldn't recommend sitting up here though if you are bothered by a light of people standing around drinking and smoking. If you are looking for more relaxed dinner vibes eat inside. Some weeknights I am sure wouldn't be bad but weekends especially it is mostly for the drinking crowd. 
I had the spicy vegetable stir fry and it was good. I am a huge spice fan so I can handle a lot and I felt this was spicy in a way I enjoyed but something others would find overly spicy. Will def. have to come again.

I just remembered that I needed to update my WW review.
The restaurant is still good.  The service is still good.  Not a lot has changed in my thinking out front.
BUT if you are in need of a talented management and staff to be able to help you with a special event, I highly recommend hitting Al and the gang up for use of their back room.
We took Beards BeCAUSE to Whiskey for our inaugural "No Laughing Matter" show.  It was a night of stand-up comedy to combat domestic violence.  Yes, I come up with some odd ideas.
The crew at Whiskey were extremely accomodating.  They made it easy for the crowd and servers to communicate without disturbing the comics and offered their full menu.  (I housed the steak and asked for bacon added to my mac and cheese in between shows.)
We comfortably sat about 55 for the first show and 65 for the second.
When the first show ran a little long, the staff was totally on point with turning over the room for the second show.  And they were on the spot with more tables and chairs when the second crowd was larger than the first.
They really helped fine tune my wacky idea and turned it into a fantastic fundraiser.  We look forward to going back every year for this unique fundraiser.

Showed up at 1pm on a Sunday.  Was pretty crowded but the wife and I were the only ones in line so the wait was only ~10 minutes.  Good to go.

I ordered a lunch dish (salmon sandwich). Wife ordered an omelette (vegetarian).  Food took 50 minutes to arrive.  Mine was OK.  Wife's order was f'd up but we were starving after waiting so long, so we let it slide.  Both meals were OK at best.

Will give a second chance at some point, but with so many good choices in the area that can seat and serve in under an hour, I have a half a dozen other places to go that have better than "OK" food.

I need to be fair here.  The wait was not unusual as far as I could tell; all those around us that were seated in a similar timeframe took just as long to receive food.  So this place just runs slow.  This is most likely a function of how the kitchen is smaller than the galley in my apartment, despite probably serving ~150 guests at a time.

Best part is food is comparatively cheap vs most brunch spots.

Bottom line: Whiskey FailHouse

ABSOLUTELY WORST RESTAURANT EXPERIENCE EVER! Literally. Look at my reviews for other places. The service was terrible. Food too. The server refused to honor the happy hour pricing when I asked for an item to be replaced. That definitely sealed her fate with the tip I left. Additionally, she was nowhere to be found most of my visit. Definitely won't be back. I love when I visit somewhere for dinner for the first time and they leave me with lasting impressions.

What can I say but every experience here has been great! 

My first experience was for lunch and the chicken sandwich was amazing. Unfortunately it is no longer on the menu. My co workers big fish was amazing as well and he gets it most of the time goes.

I have also been here for brunch and oh my it was heaven! My GF and I got the hangover helper and we both enjoyed it tremendously. I would say hold off on the syrup until you tasted it as it was a little over kill. A little to much on the flavor palate. 

The couple with us had a burger and omelet and loved theirs as well. We had the pimento cheese poppers and I was surprised at how great they were. I would say get them at least once. 

Staff had always been friendly and have always been great service.

I go here any chance I get!

Came here to watch the Giants game since it wasn't on at home.  Decided to partake in some $2 mimosas and my friends tried the $3 bloody mary's.  We knew we'd be here for a while so we decided to eat smething right away and then again later.  I had the wings in the barbalo sauce, combo of buffalo and bbq.  They were really good, had a bit of a kick but it evened out w/the sweetness of the bbq sauce.  My friends had fried green tomatoes, which I didn't try but have had them and I really like them, and spinach and atrichoke dip, that was really good too.

After a few hours we decided to eat again and we had grilled cheeses all around.  My nephews had them here once and we all kept stealing bites because it was so good!  I got mac and cheese as a side and the others got fries and sweet potato fries.  Grilled cheese was delish but the sides are not their strong point.  Fries are bit soggy and the mac and cheese was okay, but I didn't find myself digging in like I normally would.

I like it here, the beers are decently priced, its a nice bar, and the staff is pretty good.  I was here early so parking wasn't an issue, but I know it can be.  The clientele was very mixed, there were families, couples out for brunch, some elderly people, plenty of rowdy football fans, but nobody off putting.  All in all I like it here and tend to forget about it.  I will def be back!

I met a few friends out here last night and really enjoyed my evening. The bartenders were quick and friendly. I enjoyed the DJ's music - nice mix of some new and old school. Of course I drank whiskey. Drink prices were reasonable. There was a good mix of different types of people in the crowd. Not as many "frat boys" as others have reviewed.

I did not have any food, but would go back to try it. So my 4 star rating is just for drinks and the evening vibe of the place. 

I would go back.

I had been to whiskey warehouse to meet with friends for a drink but I am writing this review based on my most recent experience. It started out negative but actually ended very positive and I do plan on going back! I was at the front bar trying to get a drink when one of the bar tenders tended to people on either side of me and completely blew me off for almost the whole first quarter of one of the playoff games even when I tried flagging her down multiple times. I had been gone so long my friends had to come look for me because they thought I had left! I never complain about bad service to a manager but this woman had caught me on a bad day. I went and spoke to a bar tender in the back about the situation and she got the manager. I spoke to her about what had happened and she was extremely understanding and comped me a drink. Her and the bartenders at the other bar turned my negative experience to a very positive one and I greatly appreciated it! I would return because of the great service recovery and the fact that I don't want to let one person ruin my experience for an establishment!

Let's just suppose you are not a fan of having a wide selection of Whiskey, Bourbon, and Scotch at your fingertips that is reasonably priced. Or even if you could care less about an intriguing beer menu of both local an national brands. Maybe you don't even drink alcohol! You should still go to Whiskey Warehouse. The Plaza Midwood location is a neighborhood I love because of the community and the other restaurants and bars in the area, but Whiskey is a little different. Hardwood floors, walls, tables, everything gives it a bare stripped down feeling, but if the wood looks less than comfortable that pop a squat on one of the lush overstuffed leather couches in the corner. The food is fan-freaking-tastic! Wings, ribs, steak, and even great salads and sides for my vegetarian friends. It's never really that crowded, which is perfect because it isn't really that big but somehow gives off a spacious vibe. Maybe it's the high ceilings or giant plasma tv's over the bar. Whiskey is a great place to start or end your night. They have fun events and month long drink specials! "Home of the $4 Jack Daniels," is a great slogan they proudly boast, but I just love it for ambiance, selection, and general merriment.
Love it! Came here with friends to relax and watch the game. Upper patio has a great breeze for these summer nights.

The service is great, they will make sure everything is taken care of for you. The food is great, drinks are awesome and the rooftop view of the city from plaza midwood is priceless. Get there early to grab a seat, it can get crowded during busy evening hours and weekends. Definitely worth it for great vibes and drinks while taking in the view of the city.

i first noticed this place existed yesterday when we were on our way to the Penguin and the stupid bus couldn't decide if it was stopping or not at the Thomas Street light so i had to roll up to the next street where Whiskey Warehouse awaited. We decided to come back and give it a try.  

We really liked the feel of the place, exposed brick walls, whiskey bottle pub tables, plenty of whiskey decor going on. There were a number of tvs but the sound didn't seem to sync with the tvs i was watching. i'm assuming that is something that will be worked out.  

Unfortunately, i have to work today so i couldn't really explore the whiskey or beer options. Waitress said $2 Bud Lights today and $4 Jack everyday i believe. 

So we were there for the food. While not a huge menu, there was enough to choose from with most of the standard fare. Of course, i went with the buffalo chicken wrap ($8) minus tomato. It wasn't bad, the sauce didn't seem to be simply on the chicken pieces giving it some buffalo taste even if you were just chewing on the wrap and lettuce which i appreciate. The regular fries weren't bad but the sweet potato fries weren't much better and probably not worth the dollar upgrade. The sweet potato fries don't compare to the ones from the Penguin. 

The warehouse chicken received a thumbs up at our table and the Prime rib sandwich was given the "it was ok" rating. 

Our server was on top of our drink refills.

i kind of like this place fitting in to the area, sure it isn't too 'eclectic and fun' but it gives a unique watering hole option.

Margaux is easily the best bartender at whiskey warehouse. She's super attentive, an awesome bartender, and was really great at picking out shots we were looking for. Except for the 4 horsemen. I hate her for that. But she's cool, and better than anyone else. Totally jealous of her tattoos too.

Love coming to this place on Mondays for their half off wings. Maybe not the best wings in town but they're pretty dang good. They also have a decent selection of beers on tap and always have have jack Daniels specials. The rooftop bar has a great view of the city and is a fun place to hang out. I would suggest it for a fall game day retreat. Bloody Mary bar is fully stocked on Sundays for brunch!

Cool place!  I love the ambience... huge bar, lots of tables and booths, big leather chairs, chandeliers.  It's a Gentleman's bar where ladies are welcome.  I like it.  I don't know much about Whiskey but this place makes me want to try their many different kinds.  Oh, and I loooved the music that was playing.  Next time I'll try the food and report back.
Nice rooftop deck. They don't have many beers, but some different mix drinks made up for it.

I've been to Whiskey Warehouse a few times over the past year, and I have never really been blown away by anything. They have a pretty cool vibe going on with a country-western/roadhouse type theme. Also they have three main sections in the building with the main dining room, the "Single Barrel Room", and the rooftop bar.

The main dining room is always packed and loud, and can be a good place to catch a sporting event. The Single Barrel Room is usually a little quieter and has a separate bar (although no drafts on tap). They have tables, but they also have couches and comfy chairs if you're just looking to lounge and have a few drinks, and TVs are still in abundance for sports viewing. Upstairs on the rooftop is where I frequent the most. They have a great view of uptown, a relatively good amount of seating, and also some TVs over the bar. Overall, a really cool place to go.

However... I have never had an amazing experience here. The service is always fairly slow and inattentive, and I feel like a lot of the menu items are over priced. They have a good selection of bar food and appetizers, but it's tough to find anything for less than $10. The most appalling thing to me is the price of beer. NoDa's "Hop, Drop, 'n' Roll" is one of my favorite beers, and a 16-oz can will run you $9. WHOA! It's tough for me to justify going to have a couple of drinks and an appetizer with friends and forking over close to $40 with tip.

Definitely a fun place to go, but make it a special occasion, and be sure to save up for it.

Went for dinner and drinks on a Friday night and sat out on the rooftop patio. Really nice out there and service was good too, even though it was relatively busy. Four of us tried to share a pitcher but it would have been better for three people. That's about all you get from a pitcher, three drinks. The Lynchburg Lemonade was pretty good, had to get something with whiskey since we were there :)  Ordered the Monterey Chicken Sandwich and it was really good! Grilled chicken with salsa, guac, and cheese on a really good bun and the fries were the real kind with the little crispy skin pieces, so good. Everyone else got burgers and all finished so seemed to be good. Boyfriend got the Elvis burger that had bacon, cheese and pb on it! He liked it even tho sounds kinda strange to me. Said he'd have a burger with pb on it again :) Anywho, we'll definitely return sometime. Prices aren't too bad, great view of Uptown from the patio and heaters up there for the cooler weather. Plus its close to other bars if you'd like to hop around Plaza Midwood for the night.

The only place I will watch BAMA Football on a Saturday afternoon/evening! I mean who can really beat $4 Jacks, come on!! I love the atmosphere here, everyone is usually really nice and speak to you like we were friends in college. I love the rooftop bar especially when its a nice day outside since it can get a little loud downstairs. The wings and burgers have always been my go to when I come in and watch the game. I have also heard the buffalo chicken dip is a must try! I still need it try it myself. I always have a good time at Whiskey Warehouse, only down side is parking can be a little hard to find in the area but besides that love this place!

Wow. What a cool venue. $4 Jack Daniels whiskey all the time will certainly keep my husband coming back.

We came in as a group of 4 for dinner and drinks. One star off because it was too loud to have a good conversation but the food was decent bar food and came out quickly. The pretzels were delicious. My friend had the pasta dish for a simple $12 and coming from the northeast, that is unheard of! I could certainly get used to these prices!


As for the atmosphere - very loud, lots of sports games on TV and it seemed like there was a dj playing. The upstairs has a rooftop deck that I'm excited to visit in warmer months!

Love whiskey warehouse!! I'm upset they don't do their wing special on Mondays anymore and even more upset when a place that's known for whiskey runs out of whiskey!!! This has happened twice already.

I came here last night and I think our family may have found a place where we could become regulars. Coming in, first thought was that it was a bar...but not like every other bar where only sports ruled the televisions. It had a family feel as most bars didn't. On top of the family feeling, service was great. Our waiter was on top of everything and we even shared a nice conversation with her.

So lets get on to the food. I ordered the Charleston Shrimp Pasta which I thought was pretty good. It was a well portioned meal, with garlic bread, cheese, and of course shrimp on top of linguini pasta. I thought it was great. It had a nice blend of taste as well as a cheesy taste which I say is always good. It wasn't too overpowering to the point where you couldn't taste any of the other flavors of the dish.

Other dishes that were ordered were of course the Fried Green Tomatoes. It seems like it's a favorite around here so we decided to order it and it was good! There were no complaints about that dish.

Overall, I felt like this place was a great restaurant for families and drinkers alike. With a loft with a great view of the city (which I recommend to go during fall when it's cooler) and drinks and food, you won't go wrong!

This is one of my favorite bars to frequent in the Charlotte area. The staff is always very friendly and attentive and the food has never disappointed but the rooftop patio is the highlight of this establishment. Come for the view and stay for the brews and food!
Fun, cheap, exactly what I expected, the roof is cool. The staff is friendly and attractive, specifically the bartenders...they were fast and nice to me. Thank you. And thank you place.

I am a big fan of this place.  First I love whiskey, it's one of my favorites.  The atmosphere here is good and so is the service.  The food is what keeps me coming back.

Before moving to the South I didn't know pimento cheese existed and my waistline was thankful.  Currently it is on the top of my list of favorite foods and my expanding waistline has to visit the gym more often to keep up.  All this rambling is to say GET THE SOUTHERN CHICKEN SANDWICH.  It is a dietary nightmare but oh so delicious.  It is a fried chicken breast with pimento cheese and bacon on a gloriously soft bun.  I've had other stuff here too and it's good, but this sandwich is by far my favorite.  Try it, you won't be sorry...unless you're on a diet.

They have indoor (downstairs) and outdoor (upstairs) seating. They have build your own bloody Marys and decent food. I really liked the buffalo chicken wrap and the chicken wings. The upstairs patio is a pretty good size and has its own bar.

I met some friends for drinks at the rooftop bar area this weekend and was REALLY hungry.  I ordered the most convenient thing to eat which were the chicken tenders.  I was a skeptic while waiting thinking the food would just be mediocre given that it seems more of a drinking type place.  The tenders and fries came out piping hot and they were some of the best tenders I've ever had!  They were really crispy on the outside but very moist and tender on the inside.  I can't wait to go back and have them again.  Service and waitstaff were pretty on point.  Friendly and accommodating and fast.

Well I don't honestly have much to say... I've been here before and their spinach dip is okay. As a vegetarian its wonderful to see a section of the menu devoted to things I can eat but I've just never ordered any of them. They have a pretty varied beer selection, which is nice, and I got an OMB Copper (or 2) for $3/pint last night. The ambiance is nice and I would probably go back. However, last night I was faced with one of those service no-nos.... actually there were two of those as well. I sat down at the bar with my friends and waited 5 minutes before either bartender realized that I was a new member of our group of 4 and that I was signaling them so that I could order. Got a beer, all was fine and then I realized I was hungry. It took another 10-15 minutes before I could get their attention for a food menu. And once I had decided it took another 5-10 minutes to get their attention that I was ready to order dinner. Let me say that the whole time I was trying to get their attention, I would raise my hand or say "excuse me" every time they passed in front of me to signal that I would like for them to come over. It was as if they were intentionally ignoring me. So I finally put my food order in (2 sides: mashed potatoes and mac and cheese) & I finished my beer. I wanted another one so I waited (again) and tried to grab their attention (again) as they were walking around right in front of me (again). I waited about 30 minutes for my 2 sides and at this point I hadn't eaten anything besides a handful of cheez-its all day so I'm getting antsy. 40 minutes pass and I still haven't received anything and I was frustrated and hungry so I cancelled my order. I didn't care to ask why or how long it'd be because they had been ignoring me all night and I didn't want to deal with that any more. Plus my friend was leaving and I didn't want to have to scarf my food down in 10 minutes. So after 40+ minutes of waiting, I asked the bartender to cancel my order & her reaction implied that she had never even put the order in. Its fine- I ended up having macaroni and cheese and chocolate cake from Harris Teeter last night in case anyone was worried about my not eating yesterday. But anyways, on the bright side, which is why this review wasn't lower, she took care of one of my beers for the inconvenience of not having any food. It was appreciated and it seems like its hard for people to take responsibility for stuff and make it right these days- especially in the service industries. I wish more businesses would do that and I'm willing to give them another chance just for that alone. Plus, as I said before, they have a whole section of the menu for vegetarian food. Can't pass that up.
Delicious burger. There is a fried appetizer ball with some sort of pepper is also very good. Rooftop view of the city is delightful.

I like Whiskey Warehouse. We go there to sit up top and have drinks and eat every now and then. I just wish they would take the feed back on their food more seriously. If they want to charge this much, they need to provide better quality food. They have 10 wings for $16. What? A SIDE salad is $6 and trust me it's nothing to write home about. Overall, it's bar food... some things are better than others but either way it's bar food and it's way over priced. If you're going for a cool environment and a drink, this is the place but don't expect much out of the food.

Went here last night around 6:30, after my fiancé came home from work. They do not have a lot of parking (shared parking with common market), and I notice some people parking in the post office lot. We actually found a spot pretty quickly, I think it was like the fourth spot in. Anyways, we were greeted as soon as we walked in. She offered inside or outside (rooftop). It was a little brisk for me so we chose inside. We were sat at a booth and within a minute our waitress came over. She was nice, but low spoken so sometimes I didn't even hear what she was saying.
