The music was a bit loud too, I felt like I had to yell during my conversation. But they had a TON of televisions, which was good because we wanted to see the end of the 4 o'clock games. We both ordered a salad (mine was a house and he chose the ceasar). We both ordered the wings, last time we came was a whiiiillleee back and their menu changed just a little. The fries did not come with the wings but now they do!! The fries are good! Natural cut and not burnt or crispy. I loved them. And the wings were good, needed a little more sauce but you can always ask for more. 

Overall, the food was good for "bar food". The server was a little shy - or soft spoken, or maybe both- but she was nice and checked on us several times. 

I will most definitely be back!
10 wings for 16 dollars; they better be the size of my arm. (Disclosure: they aren't)

After a few visits here I've really come to appreciate what they offer & that they offer it with pretty consistent service & food. I rank the atmosphere pretty high...the inside (downstairs) has a beautiful big bar, various seating options, good music playing, & plenty of tv's. The outside (upstairs) has lots of covered seating, a full bar, plenty of tv's, & a nice view of the city skyline. The food has been surprisingly tasty to me & they do it consistently. It's becoming a regular spot, especially when we learned which nights have the drink or food special we like. Cheers

We had a large group Saturday night, and were seated on the rooftop.  Great views and comfortable seating.  There were mixed comments from the group about their food.  Pimento poppers were great.  My hamburger was forgotten, and when it came they had overcooked it.  But, to their credit, a manager came over as soon as they realized it was late and they comped it. So, overall, a mixed bag, but we would give it another chance.

This is a really cool place for a snack, meal, or drinks because of their rustic decor and especially because of their rooftop view of the Queen City -- the rooftop is full service so you can eat and drink... or just drink! I recommend this place for the view, the mac 'n cheese (delicious!!) and their perfectly seasoned and cooked fries!

I tried going for brunch on a Sunday with my parents. My dad had the shrimp and grits and said it was so good that he went to talk to the cook! My mother and I had omelets and they were good, just not impressive. I will say that the biscuits were great. Who knew?! A friendly staff and great atmosphere didn't hurt either. I will go back to see what it's like for drinks and "bar food". 

They do have the bar smell going on though but you get used to it quickly.

another pretty cool spot in the trendy Plaza-Midwood area, one of my favorite Charlotte neighborhoods.  Food is pretty good and usually they have some type of half decent special going.  I would hardly call myself a whiskey guru, hell to think of it the only thing I know about whiskey is jack daniels and jim beam, which I know beam is technically bourbon, but they have a lot more options then the average going bar will.  Anyways, back to the warehouse review.  The rooftop bar is a great hangout, the wife and I have spent a few weekend afternoons here on warm sunny days.  The crowd is typically a late 20's early 30's kinda crowd, usually good people just looking to have a good time.  This isn't exactly the kinda place that makes you dying to go back, however, it is a cool place to spend some time have some drinks and you typically won't regret the trip.  I have heard the brunch is pretty decent but have not had the opportunity to partake myself.

Had a wonderful experience here!! Margaux made us feel welcome and had a blast with us, really went above and beyond with her service for us! We will absolutely be back to enjoy another Sunday evening with Margaux!

Really enjoy the food and the service everytime I frequent this Plaza/Midwood hangout!  Great TV coverage, good music, and lots of room if you want to go with a group.  And rumor has it, they are getting ready to open a kick ass roof top bar!  Can't wait for that!  FYI...parking can be somewhat of a challenge during busier times.

I love this place. I always have a great experience when I come here. I mainly come for brunch and the chicken and waffles is awesome! The sausage gravy is what makes it so good! I also enjoy their mimosas and Bloody Mary bar. The Bloody Mary bar has a great selection of mixes and toppings. I've also had their wings with the Jack Daniels sauce and their burger and they are both great!

Sorry, they've failed again! Food is not good here. I've given this place multiple tries after bad experiences! Rooftop bar is great, food is not! I'm here again for Prime Rib night. Meat is just ok, baked potato wasn't cooked through! This happens regularly! So so disappointing! Bad thing is, they just don't care! I told my bartender (Molly) my issue with my crappy meal and she was nice, yet no manager came over to apologize or to try and rectify the situation! That seems to be the norm here, that the managers just don't care? I mean, even the busboy who took my plate, apologized, but not one manager came over?

While I can't certainly classify this place as a true Warehouse (see also, Men's Warehouse), it is a great bar/addition to an already happening scene in Plaza Midwood. 

This place rules supreme in the Spring/Summer time, as their rooftop bar is one of the best in Charlotte. I believe nearby Peculiar Rabbit also has a rooftop, but it's sans bar, so I still would give my vote to Whiskey in this particular neighborhood. 

$4 Jack Daniels AllDayErrDay, which is always my go-to. Food has always been superb, and is definitely one notch above normal bar fare. 

If the weather is nice, head upstairs---you won't be disappointed.

The website says Sunday brunch ends at 2:30, but when we sat down at 1:25 we were told brunch was over and they had switched to the lunch menu. Not sure if this was a one time thing or the new norm, but highly inconvenient either way since we came here specifically for brunch food. The food we ended up ordering was great, but the service was nothing special. $12 carafes of mimosas have a surprisingly good champagne-OJ ratio (despite taking 20 minutes to get one after sitting down at our table). I'll come back here, but I def won't rant and rave about it.

I have a mixed opinion on this place.  I have ate here three times, with one YUM experience, one "That was pretty good" and one "eeeehhhhh" that was ok experience.

The salmon salad is DELICIOUS!  I would highly recommend it for a healthy option.  I also saw a few friends get it.  The only thing I will say is that the actual salmon portion has looked a little inconsistent.

I got the Buffalo Chicken wrap with grilled chicken instead of fried.  It was pretty good, nothing special.  

My ehhhhhh dish was the Prime Rib sandwich.  I was really excited to try it, especially after my server spoke so highly of it, but I was disspointed.  I think the worst part was the bun it was served on.  It was what I'd consider a "sandwich bun" you would get at a cafeteria, with weird seed things on it.

Good drink specials....Bud Light for $2 and Bloody Mary bar with a million sauces and mixes for $3.  The upstairs patio is awesome!  Though doesn't compete with the new member of the neighborhood's Peculiar Rabbit.

Got asked for leave for no reason - this place sucks   way better places to eat and drink in plaza

After receiving a snarky message from management I have decided to expand on the above review which was written hastily.

On Saturday evening multiple parties of a conjoining friend group arrived at this establishment around 7:30pm. After ordering drinks and food, a member of one of the tables who suffers with a disability began playing with a container of ketchup she was given. She accidentally let it fall over the rail and some of it fell on the bouncer. Unaware of the situation, the 15+ member party was shocked to find their bouncer yelling and threateningly the young woman in the party. Shortly afterwards the poor waitress was told to throw everyone out (even members of the party at a different table completely unaware of what had happened). After a brazen attempt to box our food (and they made sure they got money out of us), they forced everyone to leave. Management never asked what had happened and the waitress looked incredibly uncomfortable.

After posting the review and receiving a self righteous message from management I will stand behind this review in its entirety because the situation, while understandable from the other side, was handled without much tact. I am sure that many members of the party after feeling disrespected will not be returning.

As for food and drink, average at best. There are excellent restaurants and fun bars in the area, I would steer clear of this establishment as they blindly listen to aggressive bouncers instead of patrons.

The fact that I'm not really into Whiskey sort of explains the three stars. This is a VERY popular place to hangout in Plaza Midwood. My last visit I tried the buffalo shrimp for the first time and they were decent. The salmon sandwich and fried fish sandwich are REALLY good. This is a great place to watch the game.

I moved to the Charlotte area about the same time Whiskey Warehouse opened.   My first experience was not so great...  An over-crowded NFL playoff game.

Since that time, ALL of my experiences have been fantastic.   The management and staff there do an amazing job.   Sam, the executive chef, also does a fantastic job.   As a new person to the QC in 2010, Whiskey became my home away from home....   Most of the friends I have here are a direct result of my times eating and drinking at the Whiskey Warehouse.

INFESTED WITH COCKROACHES. An example would be that I came here3 times over an 8 month span and every single time there has been so many cockroaches crawling around the tables, bar and floor. I told my waitress and she smiled then walked away. Told the manager and she gave the same bs story as 8 months ago. (Oh and $10 for 5 wings...) 

Used to be an awesome place but gone down hill
Still waiting for food... 45 minutes later... :( not that crowded in here. The Mimosa is good, though.

Whiskey Warehouse has always been a favorite when in P Wood. Food is tasty (way more than your normal bar food) and service is always friendly. The addition of the rooftop bar is genius and a perfect vantage point to watch the city skyline. Had the portabella burger last time with sweet potato fries and it was all delicious. Of course, I'm a sucker for portabella burgers, those shrooms make everything delicious. 

They have a wide selection of whiskey (of course) and other liquors. And a decent selection of beer. Bartender made me a gimlet one time and it was spot on. I love me my gimlets. 

They have a great space for hanging out with a group of buddies, watching whatever sport is on, a fun night out, or even a date spot (mood lighting ftw).
The chairs on the roof are the most uncomfortable seating I've EVER sat in. Won't get anyone to stay long in these seats.

Excellent selection of Scotch, Whiskey and Bourbon!  Good pours for the price.  Knowledgable staff - they know what they got and got what they know!  Helped us learn even more about whiskeys, bourbons, and scotch.

Service is always friendly and attentive. Super fun gals!

The pimento cheese and chips Rocked! Yum!

Highly recommend Whiskey Warehouse!

Whiskey Warehouse - your service sucks and I could get better pimento cheese dip at the HT across the street.  I was here last Thursday and at 11pm a snottty manager-type lady came over and asked us to cash out because she wanted to leave for the night.  WHAT??  How can you be rude and come over so early?!  I looked at my watch and thought geeez time must have gotten away from us but no - it was only 11.  Are you kidding?  Can yall get with it?
Great rooftop and friendly service.

I would likely give more stars for this place if the service and food reviews were better. 

If I could give rankings on individual 'areas' of a restaurant and get a mediums number, I'm pretty sure this would fall in the middle. 

The best thing about this place is the location/atmosphere. This is in a great place, just outside the uptown and super convenient to access. The vibe inside is relaxed, but fun. My favorite part is the rooftop deck complete with a large "U" shaped bar in the middle surrounded by various sized tables. There's roof access from inside and outside the building. There's a pretty sweet view and it's just a great spot to take advantage of lovely CLT weather 

My visits were complete of four women on both occasions and service was mediocre. They weren't very busy, and we often found the servers standing around the register area...sometimes eating, sometimes touching their hair. Most seemed quite young. 

The beer was priced accordingly as well as the meals. They're were everlasting different dishes ordered and none of them were raved over. The true highlight for me was their sweet potatoes fries - OMG!!! I'm not a huge junk food person, but when I have good food out in front of me...all bets are off. These things are magical. I would say they're in between a shoe string and regular sized straight cut fry, made of delicious sweet potatoes. They were perfectly cooked and I don't think even one of the big ones were soggy. I personally think soggy fries (sweet or regular potato) are THE WORST! These babies are on point.. I ate all of them, but left the chicken tenders as leftovers
Food was delicious but my server on the rooftop was beyond awful this past Thursday. I won't be back.

Met some friends for a few drinks and some appetizers. After being rushed to order, we were interrupted by a giant cockroach that ran across our table and down the wall. The manager was very understanding and comp'd us our food.  We paid for our drinks, tipped our waitress, and headed to the bar where the manager said we were more than welcome to sit. Once there, we were instructed, completely unprofessionally, by the bartender that people were sitting there still. So we went and sat at a different table. Two minutes later, the hostess told us to leave because there was a short wait.  We were left with drinks in our hand, and no where to go after being grossed out by a big damn bug.  So in short: alright food, bad service, and BUGS. It was an absolutely awful experience.
Ask for CJ or TJ. I can never remember which he goes by but super nice and will do anything to make your experience great.

My last time here (and I DO mean last time), they had lost control of their own establishment.  They couldn't get you a table or tell you how long it would be.  You were supposed to wade into the crowd and commandeer your own table.  And then, best of luck getting service.  If this is your only option for a night out, stay home.  I hope it let's me vote no stars.  One star is WAY too many.
Plaza is not a huge area but if it is summer and your in the area, WW rooftop is the way to go! I have yet to try their food, so TBC...

Normally the food here is really good but for some reason it's been flaky. Ordered wings tonight that took about 40 minutes to come out. They were fully cooked but were extremely cold in some areas. Almost as if they were previously cooked and then reheated, partially. I would've said something to the waitress but I really didn't want to wait another 40 minutes. I'll probably order again but next time I'll call ahead. Would be 5 stars because I do enjoy this place but when you charge more for wings than any other place, you need to make sure they are nothing short of perfect every single time.

What a great place to come and eat and have a few drinks on top of the roof.  Make sure to get their early during weekend nights and Thursday and Friday nights if you want to sit at the roof top bar as it fills up very quickly.  It has a casual ambience so feel free to come with a t-shirt and flip flops.  They have a nice selection of food for anyone.  They have limited draft beer options since mainly bottles.  Parking is also an issue during busy times.  Park at Harris Teeter, the post office, or on the opposite corner if no spots are available.  Their prime rib is awesome and I am a huge fan of their wings.  I make sure to order them crispy and ask them to make it as hot as they can since their sauces aren't that hot.

Wasn't impressed.  This is our 2nd time coming here to have a drink and eat dinner.  Our first experience wasn't terrible but wasn't the best either.  This time around we both ordered veggie wraps.  The menu stated it was a wrap with seasonal veggies, rice, lettuce, tomato and cheese.  Ours only had rice, zucchini and 1 tiny piece of carrot.  Some veggie wrap! The draft beer I ordered was out and our waitress had zero clue about any of the beers.  Our waitress, along with the others we saw, acted like they didn't want to be there as well.  

They have a rooftop bar here, which is pretty cool but it gets packed at peak times.  I guess if we were to come back, it would be just for a drink on the patio.  Maybe we will give the food another shot...or maybe not.

The atmosphere was the best thing about this place. The music was great and football was on the big screen. That was about all I can say positive about this restaurant. The french fries were soggy and not fully cooked, the bread on the sandwiches was stale and old and the wings were not crispy, just soggy. The manager asked if all was ok as I was paying the bill. I mentioned the fries were not fully cooked and the bread was stale. She just said she hoped it was better next time. What next time!? Never going back.

Thought I already reviewed this place but maybe not?  Oh well, it's not the first place I think of when I want to hang out in Midwood.  The service and food is par and the beer selection is sub par compared to other bars in the area.

The patio on the roof is the real benefit.  If the weather is right, there's not many better patios or rooftop locations in Charlotte to go to.  My suggestion is to try it for yourself.

The interior decor is actually pretty cozy with warm wood materials, etc.  Parking can be tough as it is with any business in Plaza Midwood so be ware.

1 star for good location (rooftop bar with a view of the city) and for the selection of whiskey. I came with a small group for dinner tonight-we were able to get a table on the roof right away. It was a nice view of the sunset over the Uptown. Was not thrilled with much of anything else the rest of the night.

There is a great selection of bourbon/scotch at the bar downstairs/inside; but you cannot order any of them upstairs on the rooftop. That was disappointing. 

We also had poor service (wouldn't see the waitress for 20 minutes at a time), drinks (both liquor and simply water) and food came out SUPER slow.

Last thing, one friend at the table ordered salmon-which came out completely raw. Besides the fact that neither waitress or manager offered up an apology, the manager actually took the salmon back to the kitchen to cook it longer, asking "if that was ok, rather than bringing out a fresh piece of fish". Will not be back.

Good enough pub food with a kind of annoying attitude.

I was happy to see something go in to the space left by Creation.  

I've been several times for supper or lunch with groups ranging from two to eight.  They have a burger with bacon and egg that is delicious, if freakishly messy, and what I usually get.  Their sweet potato fries are crispy and garlicky like I like them.  They have at least a couple of vegetarian options, although the one my partner gets usually would better be described as cheese sauce with a few vegetables over white rice (not unappealing, but not light or healthy in any way).  

There are LOTS of TVs throughout the bar and next to each booth, although they are easy enough to ignore if you want to have a conversation.  There seems to be an extensive bar, although I've never tried it.

As for the attitude, this is a restaurant with roughly eight parking spaces during the day when other businesses in the area are open.  The restaurant has decided that a good use of one of those spaces, and the one closest to the door mind you, is as permanent parking of a testosterone surrogate muscle car.  God knows I'm all for attitude and funky, but not when it interferes with function.  

The staff routinely park in the post office parking lot next door during business hours, which then leaves the post office without adequate parking.  WW's owners are adding a rooftop bar this winter, requiring even more parking.  There is a sense of entitlement and disdain for their neighbors that doesn't sit well with me.

If you are looking for a place to watch a game or for a bar at which to stop on the way home, you could do worse.  If you are looking for a good neighbor, you'll probably want to move on.

They should change the name.   Came here with 3 buddies so we could sample some different bourbons.   We each decided to get a different flight of bourbon.   NONE of our choices were available!   Yet all were listed on the menu.   And with three of the secondary choices, the best bourbon in the offering wasn't  available.   If they are legitimately out of this many selections, then the manager should be fired.   Our waitress was nice and that poor management put her in a challenging situation.   Our food was ok and the atmosphere wasn't bad.   But this is NOT a Whiskey Warehouse.   Not even close.

This place had an amazing roof top terrace.  I wish their food was as good as the view.  Food is mediocre unfortunately.  I ordered the chicken nachos.  Very sub-par.  Cheap tortilla chips, canned cheese, and pretty sure the salsa was from a jar. We really love coming to this place for drinks, I just wish the food was better.
Food sucks even for bar food wings are horrible along with their fried food and stay away from fries and mac n cheese they do have some good specials on whiskey only good thing about this place.

This is me giving Al and his staff my redemption song. I finally made it back in there, this time with my coupon, and had dinner again. I could make a comment on the service being a tiny bit slow.....but they were SLAMMED when we walked in. However, the hostess greeted us promptly and let us know she was doing her best to get us a table. We only waited a few minutes and they had us down and the server came by. I wish I remembered her name because not only was she personable, she was funny too....major plus. We ordered an Asian Style Grilled Chicken and Rice appetizer (which must be new,because the waitress was not aware of it) and it was awesome. It definitely shouldn't be overlooked when ordering. I got the Veggie Burger and my friend got a Maple Pineapple Chicken Sandwich concoction which I advised her against because it seemed like an odd combination. Stupid me....it was awesome! Both were actually really good. Beer was really cold and they had $2 Domestics....another plus. Service was prompt, especially considering they had 3 HUGE parties in at the same time. I will most def be back again and again. Oh.....and did I mention the manager also comped us free shots....that's service....with a smile!

I'm definitely a fan of Whiskey Warehouse upstairs. This trip I ordered the salmon to go. I asked that they substitute spinach for the rice which they gladly did. When I got home, the salmon was cooked perfectly and the vegetables were very nice. 
I always get really good service upstairs.
The food was great, drinks were tasty and average priced.  Will definitely be back!

First of all I should say I have never actually eaten at whiskey warehouse, because the wait is always inevitably too long. However it is always fun to enjoy drink on the top deck. We frequently get a pitcher of drinks to drink an every time have been impressed with how much alcohol they pack in for us! You certainly get your money's worth! If you are looking for a place to chill with friends and enjoy drinks, whiskey warehouse is busy and loud but can be a fun scene.
The rooftop bar is so much fun.  It was a great place to watch the fight and have a few drinks. People were friendly and it was a great atmosphere.  We didn't try any food.

I expected to walk into this place and be surrounded with girls dancing on the bar ala Coyote Ugly (sad that's what I think of when I think whiskey bar!), but was pleasantly surprised all around.

We came for a baseball game, Tuesday night around 730. There were some open tables, but we opted for the bar. Asian female bartender was great, and the beers were fresh and clean off the tap and some nights they've got great specials on domestic beers and Monday they've got a deal on ribs.

Anyway, we ordered the Protein Platter (new on the menu) and the Salmon sandwich. Protein Platter was EXCELLENT, and the salmon sandwich was cooked well but I felt like the spicy aoli lacked spice and taste.

Staff was attentive, cheerful and accurate. Food was great, but I felt the salmon was a little blah. Sure it's not your average Plaza Midwood haunt with the mix of punks, bankers and bums BUT it's really a comfy, nice bar that I'll definitely head back to.
Decent spot to get drink. Draft beers and Jack Daniels

I had a lot of fun here last night . I was a little disappointed that the roof was close but it was cold outside so that's reasonable . The bartenders did great they were very responsive for how packed they were . I haven't tried the food but I will definitely return !

If you didn't walk into a bar, you wouldn't know you were eating pub food. Amazing mac & cheese. Great wings. The 'famous' pimento cheese is awesome. If you are there for breakfast, get the biscuits and gravy. They are the best I've had in Charlotte! 

The atmosphere is great and with the new deck open it is the place to be! If i lived closer, I'd be there every night.
This place is great! I had one of the best hamburgers I have ever had! Thick, charcoal grilled, very good! The prices were reasonable and the atmosphere was nice.

Pretzel with cheese and mustard great flavor, crispy and nice and soft.

Whisky mac hamburger okay, asked for med rare, got very well done.

Liked the Bloody Mary bar, 5 dollar for a glass, 3 for a virgin. I had the sweet potato fries, very crispy. 

Wings are not jumbo as advertised on menu. Over fried and dry. Better get it with ranch to hydrate it. 

Salad not worth 9 dollars, a handful of roman lettuce with three thin slices of avocado. 
Good place to hang out on the roof top with friends for drinks. Typical bar food. Just okay.

Do not go here unless you like poor service, incorrect food, and enjoy waiting an hour for wings. Not only did our waitress take forever to take our order and bring our drinks but when the food came it was wrong. The service was unapologetic and the food was over cooked. Our drinks were constantly empty and dirty dishes were not cleaned up. The atmosphere was fun and I can imagine it is fun late at night but no way were we staying any longer.

OK, so first of all...I love Whiskey Warehouse. The food is good, the people are good, the TVs are great for watching the big game. I go there often to eat lunch. They've always been good to me and the fam. But I must update my original review. I've ordered takeout quite a few times. Mostly without and issue. But for the last three times there's been serious issues with my takeout order. And usually it's not until I get the food home in "good light" when I can tell somethings wrong. Tonight, after the 3rd time I have to change my review and rating. I ordered 10 wings and mac and cheese. 2 of the wings had bones showing and were overly dry (fried hard). And one wing was so dry, it was like dry cowhide. Needless to say I was disappointed. My hope is that they will get back to providing good food and good service on takeout just as they do when you're sitting in the establishment. I'll continue to visit WWH. But not sure how soon I'll be ordering takeout though.

If I could give less than one star, I would. Watched a very over served man continue to be served, then get in his car and drive. We simply went to get a drink and the bartender was clueless. We ordered old fashioneds, and she said "we're out of bitters, well maybe, I think". I'm in a bar called Whiskey Warehouse, and you don't have bitters. She attempted to make two drinks for us anyway, one was all water and a cherry thrown in, not drinkable. The other was a half pour of a whiskey that was not what I requested or paid for. It's no wonder everyone around us was drinking wine or beer. Never going back.

This was my first time visiting, I found this restaurant through Instagram #clteats. I was so excited to try the Grilled Tenderloin w/ garlic cream sauce, broccoli and rice. It wasn't on the menu but the staff and the Kitchen manager Chris was so awesome he made especially for me since it was my first time. The food was amazing. Definitely try this place!

I feel weird writing a review on Whiskey, because i've been coming here consistently from day one!  It's probably my favorite bar in Charlotte....that doubles as a good restaurant.  Most places that have this type of bar setting and tv's for sports, tend to slack off on the food prep.  That is not the case here!  I've tried probably 15/20 menu items at this point, counting specials, lunch, brunch and dinner and i'm always pleased!

Some of my favorite items are:
Buffalo Chicken Wrap, switching the Buffalo sauce for Honey BBQ.
Warehouse Burger and fries
Pimento Cheese App
Fried Chicken tenders in Honey BBQ
Prime Rib Sandwich.

Also, you can't beat $4 Jacks and their Bloody Mary bar on weekends!

I've been here a few times now and it has not let me down! Whiskey warehouse has one of the next rooftop bars/seating areas in the Charlotte area. It's very spacious and of course, has a great view of the city! 

The food has never disappointed. Some of my favorites are the buffalo chicken wrap, pimento cheese dip, and chicken Caesar salad. If you're in a pickle with making a decision, these three are always my go to and delicious! The menu is pretty big so I find myself being so indecisive more often than not, so it's always good to have your go tos. I always look forward to trying something different though if I am in the mood to expand my horizons :) 

Drink specials are good for what I have seen. 2$ mimosas on Sunday's, 4$ for a double....can't go wrong with that! Overall drink prices aren't too bad, pretty normal for Charlotte. Service is always super friendly, dependent upon the day and how busy it is, it can be a little slow which is expected on busy weekend nights. But overall, I always look forward to coming back and trying new things and enjoying the rooftop!

Awful service! Don't try to get a table over 5 people. They won't seat you at over half their tables because the chair will be in the way. Yet you can have a party of 10 stand around a small table. We waited an hour and still wasn't seated. When I spoke with the manager, he was extremely rude! Don't eat here! So many other restaurants in the Mid Wood area would be grateful for your business. Go anyway but here!
Love this place! Came here to watch the Elite 8 games and spent most of my Sunday afternoon here. Service was great and I was happy all of the TVs had my Tarheels on!!

So....checked out the place on Saturday night. I've only been here one other time and it was for lunch, so I don't remember too much about the place. From reading other reviews, i'm assuming the upstairs is a recent addition? I'm sure it will be a 100% return investment for WW. Parking was pretty difficult to find, but i'm sure it was probably even worse than normal this weekend b/c of the locals that were trying to flee to other places away from uptown, due to the CIAA tournament in town for the weekend. I'm a sucker for places with no cover, so that earned WW some points. We got there around 11pm and the downstairs area wasn't really that crowded. We walked upstairs and it was pretty packed....kinda hard to walk around, but hey, that's life, right? The ladies there were pretty good looking and appeared to be well put together. I'm a people watcher, so I look at everyone....as for the fellas, like others have touched on, there were your typical frats and older gentlemen that look like they just came out of retirement, but haven't been out in so long, they don't know how to fit into a social environment....Sperrys boat shoes, button down shirts tucked into jeans (oh my goodness, a fashion pet peeve for me....almost worse than flip flops with jeans and a hoodie), sportcoats that look like they came from the two piece suit that they probably wear during the week for work.....anyways, gotta stay on topic right?  Music was your typical 80s/90s hits that most bars play.....nothing special. Drinks were reasonably priced, spectacular views of the Uptown Charlotte skyline and that purrty Duke Energy Building. Would definitely check out the place again as I do like to switch up my spots....it has potential to be a good Spring/Summer joint

So- I have a theory. A group of guys at WW need to go to Soul and a group of girls from Soul need to check out WW. Basically, this is a sausage fest and the men look a little confused about why there are SO MANY GUYS there. Trust me guys, Soul is where the girls are.

This isn't really my scene, but the upstairs bar is a really great view of Charlotte. The drinks are good. The menu has some favorites (prime rib slider thing, wings, so on). 

LADIES- this is a brilliant place to go if you have a couple of girlfriends and you want some free drinks. Trust me.

Sports fan's paradise.  Seriously, there are flat screens almost lining the perimeter of the place, and a big open bar area allowing for large crows without getting crunched together.   The major drawback, in my opinion is that it's hella loud, but if you're there for the game, we'll just call that 'energy.'   If you're looking for a place to have a conversation over dinner and are not that into sports, I'd probably grab a drink there and then head to a quieter place for dinner.

I really like this place BUT the other reviews are correct. It's hit or miss when it comes to service. I eat here ALOT. A whole lot....but lately the staff keeps changing. The ladies that know us as a regulars treat us fabulous especially Brandy but the rest....not so much. I came in for brunch today. I sat at the bar since I was dining alone. There were 8 people at the bar, max. I sat for several minutes and the bartender never even acknowledged my existence. I really wanted a waffle and realized the patio was open so I went upstairs. Night and day. Ashley greeted me promptly and was attentive. I also notice that lunch service is pretty bad. Last week they had to comp my lunch because the waitress never put my order in. Why do I keep coming back?  Because I really like the food. I normally stick to a salad with salmon or the waffles for brunch plus they have $2 mimosas. Also half price apps from 4-6pm.

The cost of wings have gone up for every restaurant, yet whiskey warehouse has decided to discontinue the special in which it got popular off of. I dont like that idea, what's next the $4 Jack will stop?? BS

Met some friends here on Sunday for drinks and food.  I've stopped in here for drinks before but had never ordered any food.  They had bloody marys for $3, along with mimosa's, redneck mimosa's, and bud lights for $2.  I thought the redneck mimosa's were especially good; they are a mixture of lions head beer, orange juice, and a splash of ginger ale.  

I'm not a huge salmon fan but the the salmon salad looked especially good for $9 and the chicken tenders were nicely breaded and very fresh.  I had the southern sandwich which consisted of a fried chicken breast on a bun with bacon, pimento cheese, lettuce, and tomato on top...great sandwich!

I love the fairly new rooftop patio here - just awesome! My only complaint is that you cannot get food service there. I will say the bartenders were very accommodating and friendly. 

We went downstairs (after about a 10 minute wait) to get a table for 6. 15 minutes later no one even greeted us - I asked a nearby server if she was ours and she replied no, I then asked if she would get the server who was ours. 10 minutes later still nothing so I went back to the hostess who about 10 minutes later sent over that original server who claimed we weren't hers. If they were really busy I might have understood but we watched our "server" flirt with several guys at the bar and then stand around and chit-chat at the hostess station. After I explained to her that we would be leaving she just lamely said "oh sorry" . We went over to Jacks where the service was fantastic. I think management really needs to work on giving great service because they missed out on 6 dinners and several drinks...not to mention I may think twice about going there on game-day due to poor service.

Wait staff needs to learn how to do breakfast....not asking if coffee needs to be topped off, stopping by after dropping off the food and before bringing the check would be nice.  No, they were not busy and had enough staff.  You could tell because they were all in one corner socializing.
Went here to celebrate a birthday with a group of 5.  The service and the food was great.  Would highly recommend.

They were already low on my list. Now they don't even have boneless wings on their half off options for Monday nights. So basically it's adios - I will not be returning. There is literally nothing here for me anymore.

My friends and I come here after going to Common Market on Wednesday for the beer tastings. We've usually sat on the rooftop bar, taking advantage of the nice weather at night. Not so sure how that will work out for us next time though!

The rooftop bar has a great atmosphere. I've been up here on a Saturday night as well when it was pretty crowded, and I still thought it was great. My group has never had a problem finding a table to sit at, and it's usually 6 of us or so. Then again, we arrive a little later, around 9:30ish. The bathrooms at the rooftop are also nice and clean, though they are just one stall only.

The drinks are good, but I usually get the same thing every time and I've discovered each bartender makes them different. Some are better than others. Also, depending on who's in the kitchen, the food will be better than other nights. I had the Whiskey Glazed Salmon salad and it was very good. I definitely recommend it!
Came here for drinks with friends. I wasn't really into the music they were playing but I shouldn't be surprised. Their sangria were good and refreshing!

Worst service I have experienced in a while. 20 minutes for drink refills. 20 minutes after our food was brought out WRONG before we were checked on. Keep in mind this is a SUNDAY AT 10pm. Not crowded. No comps occured, which should have since I spent almost a hour of my life waiting to be waited on. Don't spend your time or money at this joke of a establishment.

A warehouse full of whiskey -sure, sounds like fun. A few of us dropped by Whiskey Warehouse after a late dinner down the street. 

We arrived around 9:30 pm on a Friday night and, while it wasn't super crowded it was starting to fill up. The music was definitely loud and they were playing all sorts of tunes, mostly rap & pop when I was there. I agree with Julia S. - the crowd was pretty frat like - but frat brothers 10 years post-college. 

We were able to order drinks right away and the bartender was fairly friendly and efficient. Just as their namesake states, they have an extensive whiskey menu, and I would hope the servers are helpful in those selections, but none of us partook in those libations. They also had a decent wine selection, too. Inside, WW sports a number of big flats screens and a partial brick/industrial feel inside. 

I imagine if you can score a table, this would be a good spot to hang with some friends for a few hours. They also offered some fairly sweet daily drink specials - one that caught my eye is their Sunday drink special - $2 mimosas and $3 Bloody Marys. Mmmmm hmmm...can't wait until noon on Sunday!

The only reason I give this place a 2 star rating is because the only time I have been here was when it first opened up. The bartenders did not know how to make drinks right and I got overcharged that evening there which prompted me to go to Thomas St. Tavern instead. The rooftop does have a new nice view of the Charlotte Skyline. I have heard great things about the food but have not tried yet. Update will come once I go back. I hope the service is a lot better too.

Is this the best patio in Charlotte? Quite possibly. 

A rooftop bar with a tremendous view of the city. Pair that with great food and the Plaza Midwood neighborhood. Money. 

I've had a little bit of everything from the menu. No complaints. All good. Love the wings. There are daily lunch specials. Thursday is prime rib night. $13/$15 is a great deal. Half off apps Monday-Friday from 4-6pm.

Tons of beers. A good selection of local suds. Great drink specials throughout the week. On Sundays, $2 mimosas and $3 for the bloody mary bar. 

Parking is the one issue here, but that's everywhere in Plaza Midwood. 

Back to the patio... It's no secret. Want to do happy hour? Get there early. 

Lunch, dinner, date night, drinks with friends, Sunday fun day. This place is perfect for it all.

I'm giving this place 2 *s for the rooftop patio and the great views only! I had the fish and chips and it was fried too hard and had no seasoning at all!! The chips aka French fries looked and tasted like they were a day old and just dropped back in some hot grease! I will return for the patio and views but no food for me!! Sad part is the cook told me about this place..shame on him!!

I went to Whiskey Warehouse to watch the Superbowl and thought it was a decent place to hang out, but nothing special.

We were seated pretty quickly which impressed me given that it was a busy night and we showed up a little bit before kickoff. Our waitress and service was great, but I wasn't blown away by the drink and food options. While the whiskey menu is extensive, the beer selection is lacking and quite pricey.

The rooftop bar seems like a chill place to hang in summer, so I might be back for that!

They have pretty good bar food, if you can find even one member of their staff that cares about getting it to you. I've given this place like 5 tries. I'm done.

Let me break down your average visit to Whiskey Warehouse.
Step 1 - Walk in and wait 5-10 minutes for a server or host to greet you. 

Step 2 - Wait at your table another 10-15 minutes for your server.

Step 3 - After your server is done updating their Instagram at the server station she will come up to you shocked and appalled that you're the type of horrible human being that would dare order food at a restaurant. How dare you. HOW DARE YOU! She can't even.

Step 4 - Your order is sent to the kitchen and I can only assume the ticket is printed in some type of  ancient language that the staff has to take several hours to break down and translate.

Step 5 - Explain to your friends and family why they haven't seen you in months. Why you've missed holidays, work, birthdays. 
Spoiler: It's because you're STILL waiting on your food.

Step 6 - Get your really solid bar food. Mostly super basic fried food and burgers. It is good tho.

Step 7 - Hope to god you have cash to leave on the table because I can't imagine having to wait to get your check back.

Step 8 - Step outside and cherish the fact that you've seen daylight once more.

A couple of sides to this.
Only order something from the bar if you're some kind of weird person that loves punishment. Like the only way you can enjoy that beer is by suffering impossibly for it first.

I once ordered a to go pretzel to go. The person that took my order said 10-15 minutes. I literally laughed after we hung up. I being the expert planner that I am showed up in 25 minutes, fully expecting to wait another 5-10 minutes. After 45 minutes ... I got my pretzel.

The management is super nice and very apologetic, but at some point sorry isn't good enough and you need to fix your mistakes.

If the place was one street over it would have closed down 1 week in. Their location and the fact that a place called "Whiskey Warehouse" will bring in every frat bro within 50 miles is the only reason they stay afloat.
Good location in plaza midwood. Enjoyed some beers & buffalo shrimp. Look forward to going back for prime rib night & to check out the roof when it warms up
Your typical Charlotte bar. Brussel sprouts can be delicious but the kitchen is extremely inconsistent. Probably won't go back for more than drinks.
Great atmosphere and good food...that's affordable!  Don't forget to check out the rooftop area!

We just returned from lunch at the new Whiskey Warehouse and based on the very few (as of this writing) reviews out there on the internet we didn't know what to expect. I have to say that I was pleased with the experience overall. We used to frequent the previous establishment at this location called Creation and wondered how they would change the layout and decor. Well, it's nothing at all like the former restaurant. It truly has the look and feel of a combination saloon and warehouse - hence the name (with a few high tech touches thrown in). A lot of dark woods and an open floor plan make it inviting and unpretentious. The long bar which goes nearly 3/4 of the length of the restaurant is sure to be one of the neighborhood's most popular draws. 

Even with the small amount of people in there at 11:45 a.m. on a Wednesday I was surprised at the noise level. My dining partner and I had to talk loudly to be heard. I think it was partially because there was a large 50" television with the volume on less than two feet from us coupled with the exposed ceiling and general openness that doesn't absorb sound. If that place ever fills up it will be ear shattering. At the very least they should mute all of the televisions so people don't have to talk over them - with the exception of maybe during Panthers games or larger events like the Superbowl. 

My dining partner and I enjoyed the food but didn't partake in any libations since it was still the middle of the workday. We plan to come back for a happy hour sometime in the near future. I had the prime rib sandwich and sweet potato fries. I would grade both at about a B. The well-seasoned beef was shaved instead of a big slab and I preferred it that way. The bun was nothing more than a large hamburger bun and I would have preferred a nice Ciabatta bun or Sour Dough hoagie instead. I also would have liked more of a kick in the horseradish mayo. It was a bit tame and I could barely taste the horseradish. The sweet potato fries were good but unspectacular. I mean, they are just fries so there's not much you can do with them, but they were worth the $1 up charge. Portions for both the sandwich and fries were large. I really felt like I got my $9 worth. My dining partner had the Whiskey Glazed Salmon Salad. She was very happy with it. She was certain the salmon would be overcooked as most restaurants do but she was happy with how it was finished. Her salad was also a very large portion and she said she would definitely order it again...in her words "a keeper." 

The menu to us was just the right size. It was double-sided with about 30+ salad, sandwich and entree items plus 8 or so appetizers. There was a little something for every taste including vegetarians (but nothing vegan because of the dairy). 

Again, we can't speak to the drink menu but it's clear they have just about anything you would want. There were a couple of drink specials written on the board so there is probably something for every budget too. I see this place becoming popular with the after work crowd. Since the bar is so large it seems like a nice place to belly up and hang out with coworkers and friends for a few cocktails on a Friday evening. 

Service was fine. It was about what you would expect at your basic neighborhood restaurant - enough attention without feeling either swarmed over or neglected. Our water glasses were always full and the food was brought out in about 10 minutes. 

I realize the place is new and has yet to develop a following but I was surprised at how empty it was at noon. It was just the two of us and a small group of firefighters from the next door station. There also appeared to be one of the owners or managers with a vendor at another table discussing business. But that was it the entire time we were there. 

If this restaurant is to survive where others in this location have failed (and the owner is reading this) they need to get the word out aggressively. Word of mouth will only go so far. Consistently send around fliers to local businesses with drink specials and coupons and I predict they will fill the place very quickly. And if they keep serving good food with good service like they did today they will hit a home-run in the Plaza Midwood area. 

I think 3 to 3.5 stars is appropriate. That doesn't mean it's bad, just not extraordinary. I'll call it above average. We will be coming back for sure.

Above average whiskey selection! 
I was impressed how this place has "Jack Daniels" stamped on nearly everything. The place is a giant billboard for Tennessee whiskey. 
When we arrived, it was super loud. They had a DJ playing dance hits, with people getting out of their seats and getting rowdy with the music. The place had a definite fratty vibe. 
The whiskey selection was decent. I've seen much better lists of bourbons, and it seemed like they were mainly just picking out as many whiskeys as they could. They were missing great bourbons, but I guess it's not a bourbon warehouse, huh? 
They offer a variety of decent locally brewed beers, which was exciting. The beers were nearly all $5. 
The service was pretty good, our drinks never went empty, and we were checked up on regularly. 
The place is clean, and well kept. It has a classy interior, with an awesome rooftop patio! 
My favorite thing about this place was the number of televisions that they had going. They're on every surface around, each tuned to a different sporting event. This seems like a great place to catch a game!

I'm going to start off by saying great atmosphere and a great rooftop bar... However the service is terrible! I went in with another girlfriend of mine around 11pm on a Friday night. We sat down at the bar downstairs (which wasn't overly crowded) and ordered a couple of drinks. We let the bartender know we were checking out their late night menu but needed a minute. After a few mins of talking we decided on some food to order and shots... It took the bartender at least 35-40 mins to come back to us. After she had helped almost every guy at the bar was it she noticed us waiting. We promptly asked for our checks without ordering anything further because at this point watching people walk up to the bar and get helped while we were sitting there waiting was beyond frustrating! On our way out we decided to walk upstairs in which we ran into a group of our friends who were having a going away party. We once again decided to try an order shots but the bartenders upstairs were to busy chatting and dancing to notice there were people waiting! No one wants to stand around waiting forever for a shot! Once again it's a great place to hang out but just don't expect any good customer service!! Already saw a bad review about being a female and trying to get service here and it's 100% true!
This is a great place to go after work. I love to go upstairs to the patio that overlooks uptown. The food is pretty good. It's typical bar food. The drinks are really good and inexpensive.

My boyfriend and I came here the other week and sat at the bar downstairs. Usually we sit at the bar upstairs on the roof because it has such a great view, but it was a little too warm for that so we figured we would give the inside bar a try.
It was around 4 in the afternoon and it was just us and two other guys sitting at the bar. 
The bartender quickly greeted us and took our drink order.
My boyfriends drink took maybe a minute, and she dropped it off and walked away. My drink however, showed up almost fifteen minutes later, after she stood at the other end of the bar and had a conversation with a co worker. I let it go, because for all I knew it was an important drink related conversation. 
A bit later when our drinks were looking pretty low she returned, but only long enough to ask my boyfriend if he would like another and then walk away while I was mid sentence trying to let her know that I'd like another drink as well. 
She promptly brought his drink and walked away again, ignoring me as I again, tried to ask her for another drink for myself. 
After ten more minutes of her ignoring me as she kept walking past, the gentleman at the bar beside me finally flagged her down and informed her that I'd been trying to get her attention for a while. With a look a look of total irritation, she turned to me and asked what I needed. Finally I was able to order my second drink...however it took over another ten minutes for her to bring it to me. If I had ordered something difficult then I could understand the delay, but it was just a vodka tonic.
Normally this would be the 
point where we would leave and just go somewhere where the bartenders weren't so horribly rude, but we were famished and decided to just go ahead and order our food, and hope for the best...wish we hadn't. 
While we were ordering, we actually caught her rolling her eyes at us. 
Then when the food came out, she threw the plates down in front of us so hard, that part of my food fell off and landed on the bar, and then she just walked away without a word. That was all we could take.
So after another few minutes of trying to flag her down, she finally came back so we could ask her for boxes, our check, and a manager. 
She returned a few minutes later with one box (instead of the two that we had asked for), our check, and to let us know that the manager was busy and couldn't talk at the moment...Seriously?!?!
We paid and left, and will never be back.
Great environment and food!  Very reasonable prices and rooftop deck is a perfect happy hour spot.

I end up at Whiskey pretty often with clients and friends. It's a nice in between priced spot that has more than decent bar-ish type food. 

Their pimento cheese appetizer is one of my favorite pimento cheeses in town. The chips it comes with are cheap though; but the cheese is so good it basically doesn't matter. They also have a chicken sandwich with the pimento cheese on it and that also rules. 

Their wings are some of the best in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood. Specifically their dry rub recipe. They don't always have them though. Once they're out sometimes it's a couple of days before they have another batch. 

The upstairs patio has a great view of the city and on a nice day the bar area up there is spectacular. They've started food service up there now which is great. The wait staff is typically hit or miss. I've had good and terrible. Kind of depends. At peek hours they're always on. I've tried a few times to watch a game or two there but it just gets SO loud. Not my favorite place if it's prime time and you're trying to have a nice quiet meal.

My reivew is based off of only the roof top bar area.

What I do like about this place is that it's hoppin-and-poppin with people.  The pretty, the ugly and all us in between.  They made STRONG drinks too.  I should probably put that in the "what I don't like" section.  I'm 30ish..strong drinks are never good for me.  

What I didn't like was the CROWDED roof top.  You couldn't put your arms in the air and wave'em like you just don't care even if you wanted to.  People stepping on my toes was fun.  Just too crowded for my taste.  Gosh I sound old.

I have been hearing about the great patio at Whiskey Warehouse; so I decided tonight was the night I was going to check it out. I had a great experience with my bartender Chrissy; she was so friendly & had great customer service (you don't see that anymore) with all her bar guests. She really made me feel welcome!! I will definitely be coming back to here to see Chrissy!!

Moved to Plaza area not long ago and trying to get well acquainted with the local spots. Dined here a few times now and have thoroughly enjoyed every time. Always great drink specials and food has always been very tasty. My Personal favorite, the chicken nachos. Do yourself a favor and try them!!! Also great wings and great food specials on different days as well. 
Just a great little neighborhood spot for a good bite to eat and hangout with some good friends. Also, if the weather is nice, try siting on the rooftop, the view is just great!

Came here to meet up with some friends while working in the Charlotte area. It was a nice crowd with a good mix of people from younger to older. I went on a Saturday night and I enjoyed the rooftop bar and the music that they were playing. Overall it's a Great spot to go to in that part of Charlotte

Great food. Drink specials are pretty solid. The service is very hit or miss. Sometimes it's great, but more often than not, when we order food from upstairs its cold by the time we get it. And sometimes the service is slow.

Well, it seems the potential for upscale whiskey bar is being squandered on the frattiest crowd ever to descend on Plaza/Midwood (which is saying a lot, considering the crowd TST draws). Since the cask beer is my main reason for coming here - and its seldom on tap - I'm giving up. 

The parking in this area has always been tight but its been taken to a whole other level of screwed since WW opened. Harris Teeter and CVS have put towing programs into effect because patrons of this joint (and hey, others too, but no one really complained until, coincidentally, right after WW opened) are too lazy to park in the municipal lots scattered around the 'hood. Watch out driving by the place in the wee hours, too - you'll inevitably be lunged at by Turd Ferguson and the Misses, thinking you're the cab they called. Idiots.

Whiskey Warehouse is a great place for spring/summer to hang out on the rooftop balcony. It's always busy and with an eclectic group of people, all nice. There are also several televisions to catch whatever sport is on tv. In this case, it was March Madness. You WILL struggle to find a table and pretty much have to stalk one to wait for people to get up or just make friends while they're sitting there. I had the special of the day on my last trip, which were shrimp skewers over rice with spinach and tomatoes. It wasn't anything special, but filling and with enough lemon spice to forego salt and pepper. Whiskey punch is also pretty good. Come for the sun, new friends, and drinks. Parking is terrible in Plaza Midwood in general, so be prepared to deal with it.
Amazing service by our waitress,Tiff. She was very attentive and nice. Food was great, awesome atmosphere and you can get a pitcher of jack and coke!

I'll be honest- I love Whiskey's rooftop and the $4 Jack. Not a big whiskey drinker but I always order it while I'm here. The food is not good here. I've order several items and they're literally a waste of money. The tenders are always soft never crispy. The wings lack salt or any seasoning really. If you don't order them extra crispy some will be undone. The burgers also have no flavor. I'll continue to come here and I'm still going to give them 3 stars but the food is a waste of money and time. It's still love tho

We had so many problems this night I won't go back. It's a cool vibe, but the food was awful and the customer service was just as bad. We both got sandwiches. Both were cold and soggy. My sandwich was underwhelming even if it was hot. The fries were also cold and soggy. They messed up our side orders. Just BAD food all around! When we complained they did not care or do anything. So many better places in Plaza!

If you are a female don't expect service. The Asian girl won't even mAke contact with you. Only nice girl was a bar back who couldn't get my beer but hovered the bartenders to attempt to get my beer. Girl bartenders suck!!!!
I've been here a few times and overall the food and service has been good.  The outside deck is really cool and the $4 jack drinks are awesome too.  The beer selection is also really nice.

I hate to give such a cool looking place with a decent kitchen such a bad review but the service isn't too great. 
A friend and I went for dinner last night and had no wait, around roughly 7/730, for a great little rooftop table. The server arrived late, didn't know the bar menu or restaurant menu, and kind of rushed us into choosing our food. I ordered a beer and the prime rib and baked potato. At least ten minutes later she comes back to explain they only have the prime on Thursdays, but I can get the strip - which, it turns out later, is $7 more; she failed to mention that and I didn't have the menu any longer to see what was what. THEN another server comes over- it turns out, "Haley" is on her last night of training and her trainer explains that, not only do they not have prime but they only have baked potatoes on Thursdays. Thursday's must be the time to visit. So the trainer offers us mashed potatoes instead. I agree, but tell her I'm frustrated I didn't know it was only Thursdays and she very snappily tells me something to the extent that "it's there above the steak special....it says Thursday special... We run out of it on Thursday." Like I'm supposed to intuitively know that something offered on your special, single page house menu isn't offered all week. The food comes out way later, second round of drinks takes extra long considering our proximity to the bar/the number of bartenders/number of people on the rooftop. 
My steak is overdone but I keep it because the trainee tells me my friend will be done with her food by the time I get my steak the way I ordered it. The Trainer brings us god awful shots as restitution- we don't drink them bc they are some alcohol they probably can't sell and literally have to give away. 
The manager NEVER checks on us- unless the manager is some older dude with grey hair- he came by and touched our table as he walked by, not looking at us and asked us how we were- never breaking gait, never looking at us. All this before we had food, too. 
Our bill comes, and my originally 14$ prime turned strip is now 21$, and I say something to the trainer who looks at me like I have two heads, like my steak was what I ordered originally and the right temperature, and she tells me she'll have to talk to the manager to see what they can do because, " this is unprecedented, no one has ever asked us to do this before." 
She comes back with a $3 discount and I'm so fed up I just leave it alone, pay, and leave.  
I am a server/trainer at a steakhouse. There's never a time when I don't follow my trainee around, even on last days, to make sure my customers are getting everything they need/all the info needed/ and that my trainee can see how to resolve conflict. I never speak condescendingly to my table about things they may have missed on the menu/ food we're out of. You do everything you can to make sure food someone is paying for is right.
I'm never going back there again. It had so much potential and the waitstaff and management killed whatever there could have been. For the record, the mash and asparagus were great, and the strip wasn't terrible (great cut!) for a m/w. But service is everything.
Wings are usually really good. But if you are a fan of HOT wings, the Suicide wings are more like I scratched my wrist for attention wings.

I love this place! The staff is friendly, and the food is excellent. The French fries are addictive, but if you want to save some calories the salmon salad is one of my favorites. They now serve brunch on Sundays with a do it yourself Bloody Mary Bar. I have never had a bad meal here, and since its next to my place, I eat here a lot! They also have a great wine list, and bear selection if your not a whiskey drinker. If you are a whiskey drinker try the Jack and Coke slushy. Can't be beat on a hot NC day! Great place for sports fans to watch the game!

I'm writing this review based off drinks alone.  I didn't order any food but the atmosphere is a lot of fun.  Be sure to go on a sunny day and sit on the roof top patio.  Cool vibes and great for a small group of friends.  It gets pretty crowded on the weekends so get there early (if you're day drinking) or maybe call ahead.  Very cool place and excited to hang out there this summer!

One of the best place I've been to here in CLT! Went once in a Monday got wings and they were amazing and went another time for the same and they were just as good. But went to brunch today and it was amazing I loved it. Everything was on point mimosas were beyond great. I'll be back again soon

Good selection of drinks. Food was decent for bar food, but at 10 pm they cranked the music to a volume so loud I could hardly hear my friends across the table. Waited a while for service as well. Solid meh.
Great atmosphere but food and beer are pricey for what you get. Great for game watching since they have a ton of TVs. Tables are really close together which makes it hard to navigate the restaurant.

Service was poor, food came out at different times for our group, some of our party received incorrect orders. Food runner was unapologetic about mistakes. Most of the food was mediocre. Fun atmosphere, but only good for wings and drinks.

They have a pretty solid list of whiskey. I really enjoy the idea of whiskey flights too. They usually have good drinks specials too. 

If we are going to Plaza Midwood for brunch this is the first place we will go to. They have a lot of options and all for a decent price.

There are tons of tvs and the upper roof deck is awesome when the weather is right. They even will run heaters when it starts getting cooler. It has an awesome view of the skyline and another full bar up top too. 

They also show ufc fights and not many places do that around town without charging. I would definitely recommend WW! Just be aware that they do get busy come weekend time so expect a little wait.

S-L-O-W. By far the slowest service I've ever had in any restaurant. From the drink order, to letting me know my drink wasn't available, to taking our order, & then the longest wait...getting the food! We waited about an hour for wings. WINGS! And we were one of the few people eating here. Super empty. We had ordered other things & literally asked for boxes bc we were just over it by the time it arrived. Oh & btw, one of those items was a cold salad requiring no cooking. We were also disappointed that their rooftop was closed until 4. I will say the long awaited wings tasted pretty good, but even that is not enough to bring me back here. Do not recommend!

Whiskey Warehouse could be a cool little joint if they offered a better beer selection and higher quality food. Decided to meet up with an out of town visitor for the skyline views at Whiskey this week. Unfortunately the awesome view wasn't enough to make up for the overpriced mediocre beer and subpar food. 

Ordered the nachos on special during half priced apps (4-6) and what we  received was stale chips with under seasoned queso and a few slices of jalapeños with diced tomatoes. Pretty uninspired to be honest and definitely not worth the regular price of $11. 

I would like to say I wouldn't return, but for some reason others seem to enjoy the rooftop bar enough to ignore the subpar food/overpriced drinks and I'm sure it won't be long before I begrudgingly return.

Not blown away, but they do have a pretty great rooftop bar, and plenty of TVs around for viewing whatever game you please. It was admittedly a great choice to watch UNC barely beat the Razorbacks.
They have a relatively standard selection of beer, and unfortunately their menu wasn't updated at all when we went there and several taps were completely empty.Service was great the whole night though!

I ordered the spicy teryaki wings, and I think that I have several personal preferences that were not met: I do like a thicker sauce (this one was watery), I get a bit upset when I see entire halves of wings not covered in sauce (this means they weren't tossed and the sauce was just drizzled on), and I also like crispy skin (this was definitely soggy). But the meat was hot and there was a fair amount of it! 
I also ordered a side of fries and holy cow those were DRENCHED in grease and totally soggy. Every single one of them. And there wasn't any salt either...

So although the food was on the lower side of OK, I did enjoy the atmosphere, and I'll continue to come here... I may have just come on an off day. I'll come back and try more things, and hopefully be able to bump up my experience.

Great bar in plaza midwood. Very much enjoyed the deck with the view of the city. Went for a late lunch on a Sunday, had decent mimosa specials as many other restaurants nearby. Service for food was a little slow, as there seemed to be one server for every table on the deck. Could have maybe used a little more help but otherwise the food and drinks were delicious.

Fun but raucous bar where you can definitely get your whiskey on (including tasting flights) with attractive and flirty waitstaff. Get the fried pimento cheese balls and the salt and pepper pork rinds to go with your drinks. If the weather permits go upstairs to the rooftop area where you can get a nice breeze while you take in Charlotte's atmosphere and party culture.

This is a bar you'll want to visit to watch a game. There are plenty of huge tv's. 

Had a drink at the bar while we waited for takeout. I thought the old fashioned would be amazing at a whiskey warehouse. There was still granulated sugar in the glass. Dan was told the beers on tap were $4 but was charged $5.50.

Food was okay. Fish and chips and the veg burger. I'd not order again but would try something else.

We would stop by again when back in town.

The hubs and I came here for a late lunch on Sunday.  We had meant to arrive earlier, but our neighbor Hippie Mike paid us an unexpected visit.  For hours.  Nevertheless, it was a beautiful partly cloudy day with non wilting temperatures, so we headed for the rooftop.  
To our delight, they were playing blues music.  But, soon after our arrival, it switched to the worst rock of the 90's/turn of the century, except for one song by Velvet Revolver.
Our drink orders were promptly taken, and we settled in to enjoy the magnificent view.  Everyone in Charlotte needs to come to this rooftop at least once.
My husband ordered the talapia sandwich, which he said was ok.  It was fried, and he would have preferred it baked.  But my meal?  Holy herbivore!  I got the fried green tomato sandwich (and yes, I welcomed fried with open arms.). The bun had a smear of pimento cheese on it, too.  Yum!  Our orders came with fries, which was fine by me.
I have to say it was well worth listening to Hippie Mike's monologue  of righteous opinions to have this late lunch as my reward.

Whiskey Warehouse is THE place to be on Thursday nights, if you're looking for a relaxing evening after work. Wine is offered as a special at half the price (sangria excluded!) I love to sit downstairs at the bar and chat it up with Margeoux (could be spelling it wrong) SHE'S AWSOME!  She makes the best sangria hands down! GO SEE HER. The food is always on point and the service matches. I highly recommend this place!
Good food and great service. Waitress was nice and allowed me and my dinner guest to chat and order when we were ready. The beer was good.

Ordered the chicken and waffles for brunch, as I have many times and today they cut back on the chicken.  Normally it has always been two chicken fingers on the waffle with sausage gravy, today they cut a chicken finger in half.... Really is half a chicken finger a thing.  You lost my business and I have eaten here for years

After two lunch visits I am still not blown away with Whiskey Warehouse. Yes, they have a great roof top patio, however, the service is hit or miss and the food is okay.
I have had different items each visit, chicken sandwich and today a burger.  The burger is served with lettuce and tomato and choice of cheese. I ordered swiss and asked for red onions. Came with the wrong cheese and no onions. After reminding my server she said she would grab them and never returned.  I also sat with an empty water until the bill arrived.
My friend got the salmon salad today, which came with no dressing. Once the dressing arrived he said it was okay.
The place was packed, yes, it was lunch time, but overall nothing I would run back to.  Stick to enjoying a cocktail on the patio and maybe grabbing some wings or appetizers.

THIS PLACE SERVES FOOD!!!!!

My group came here for main intention witch is whiskey.  And Whiskey we had....and had.....and had.   I love the selection of whiskeys.  They have Makers 47!

The bartenders were awesome and so easy when they have the same name

The Good: half priced wings on Monday. $4 jack everyday and the rooftop. 

Ok. I once really liked this place, mostly for the rooftop deck and tv screens. Then the last 4-5 times have been atrocious. I kept going back hoping it was an anomaly, but at this point my friends and I just find it laughable when we come home after a bad experience there. 

Service is so hit or miss; unfortunately, the waitresses are handcuffed by what is clearly a kitchen in disarray. The food always takes forever, rarely comes out right and almost always cold or undercooked. 

I'm glad to be moving out of the area and give my business to someone else.

3-star is generous, it's more like 2.5-star for my recent visit on Thursday  to meet friends for drinks.  The place was pretty packed for 9pm.  The 4 of us got some appetizers.  Nachos was HORRIBLE.  For $8, it definitely did not worth the price.  Can't believe I'm going to say this, but I would rather go to Taco Hell (I mean Bell) and get nacho there.  The pimento cheese spread was ok, look a little odd since it was mostly shredded cheese.  It had a little kick to it.  Not sure tortilla chips is the best companion for it... The best was the fried cheese balls.  

We ordered wine that night, it was half-price bottle night.  Same as my original review, nothing to complain about the drinks.  

Now on to service.  It was fine for the most part.  And just when you think something improved, one of the 3 waitresses that served our table (and she acted like she's the more "senior" of the 3) came over at 11ish, stopped us in the middle of our conversation and asked if we could tap out because she would much rather go home.  REALLY?!  Here's a news flash: how about get your rude & lazy butt home and let someone else finish out our table and get the tips that you obviously didn't deserve.  I worked in restaurants before, I waited tables, so I'm not just talking out of a pie hole with no merit.  That just totally rubbed me the wrong way.  

All these months later, food was still so-so (super sub-par for nacho... a bar food staple that's really not hard to master) and the service still needed improvement.

I enjoy Whiskey Warehouse and come here often when my fiance wants a good bloody mary bar at his fingertips. While I do come here mostly to grab a drink and walk around Plaza Midwood, I have grabbed a bite or two before. The big fish sandwich is delicious (even though I got it bun-less) It was large, crispy, and definitely hit the spot. The wings are good as well, though once my lemon pepper ones, were a little too lemony for my taste, but good overall. In short we keep coming back for the atmosphere and drinks.

Amazing food, great location. We tried sitting on the rooftop, all seats were taken- get there early if you're planning to stay just for dinner. Had the teriyaki chicken, husband had the burger with fries. Teriyaki chicken was so delicious, may have been better than any hibachi restaurant version I've had. Husband said the fries were some of the best he's had... ever. Quality, local beer and great service. Will definitely be back!

Good ole Whiskey Warehouse. First time I came here was 3 years ago when I got home from Iraq. I had not been to plaza mid-wood in years. Not a bad spot for catching up with old friends. They do have some good food as well. My favorite was walking in there on a Sunday picking up to go food for a sick friend. Food was not ready and I had to wait. They had a lovely Bloody Mary bar set up to which I helped myself to while I waited. Pretty clever I will say. They also have music on the weekends and for a bar, they get a thumbs up from me.

I got the brussel sprouts appetizer and boneless garlic parmesan wings. The flavoring for the brussel sprouts was delicious but the brussel sprouts were pretty hard still and could have been cooked longer. The boneless garlic parmesan wings were by far the best wings I have ever had. The chicken was tender and they melted Parmesan cheese on top of the wings. Usually when I order garlic Parmesan wings they come dripping in sauce and the breading is soggy. The breading was crispy and appeared to have very little sauce but they had a lot of flavor. I liked them so much I order them to go again the next day.

The view and atmosphere in the rooftop bar area is great. 

The food and drink are average(not bad), but I cannot speak for the whiskey, bc I don't like it in general.
The food here never disappoints, but sitting downstairs inside, we might as well be outside with the number of flies and gnats flying around our food...

I came in this afternoon to watch the Panthers game with some friends. A lot of people have told me that Whiskey Warehouse has some of the best wings in the city so I thought I'd give them a try. I tried the hot wings, and I thought they were way too mild and lacking in flavor. Personally, I prefer the wings at Moosehead or Lebowskis, but whatever, they were OK i guess.

Aside from the food being pretty forgettable, though, the service that we received was very good. Our server's name was Megan, and she was very friendly and attentive throughout the whole experience. She checked in regularly to make sure we had all the food and drinks we needed throughout the game.

Overall, I thought Whiskey Warehouse had a nice atmosphere for watching football on Sundays, with plenty of TVs and a good selection of beers on tap, so I would gladly come back to drink and watch sports here. That being said, with all the other excellent food options elsewhere in Plaza Midwood, I may get food somewhere else beforehand next time.

Came here tonight to meet some friends to watch the patriots play the eagles(Superbowl)... i have actually been here before during the summer, they have this cool rooftop tiki bar environment at the top of climbing the  stairs here.I didn't get much here just a appetizer and a drink. Ordered the fried pimento cheese balls they were good but just a little overkill with the amount of cheese geesh. My drink was everything under the sun the cucumber mango mule,this drink was so refreshing and the alcohol level was just right in it not too much and not too little and i had two. Want to start coming here more in the warm weather when i can sit out on the rooftop.
