I'm a tad overdue on my update. Several visits later and Whiskey isn't has horrible as the rep it seems to have accrued. Yes the fratty crowd hasn't changed much, but it's quite an eclectic fratty crowd. 

My last visit was for the UFC fight and I got lots of free schwag. Free schwag, whaaa!? Bud light sponsored the event and gave us free hats, key chain can openers, t-shirts, bottle sleeve/glove coozy thingy and free beer! Free beer, whaaa?

The drink specials are decent, $3 for OMB Copper on Saturday nights at a place that looks this new and nice?? That's a steal. Food isn't too shabby either. Good fried green tomatoes, decent wings, decent Mac n Cheese, and the barrel burger is pretty fulfilling and rad. What is the barrel burger you say? Well my friend, it's a tasty meat patty topped with chili and a fried egg of course!

The DJ still plays a lil' too much Kesha and crap though.

Joined a couple of friends on the rooftop for cocktails & apps this past weekend for my first visit.  It's my new favorite haunt.  Wish it were larger to accommodate all the adoring patrons, which by the way were fairly diverse in age which was nice.  (Although there were no children which I thought was appropriate considering it's mainly a bar.)   Although we only ordered basic bar food and a salad, all was good.  Drinks were not ridiculously overpriced which in Charlotte is a rarity.  The atmosphere is cool & cozy, the sunset view is beautiful, the service was good (bar service was stellar, table service less so but fine), and the strategically placed fans were much appreciated.  Oh, and the 80s music rocked.  Thoughtful owners.  I'll be back, again and again.  Hopefully it will remain a great experience.

Amazing experience from start to finish. We called to see if kids were okay to bring, and they were super friendly over the phone (& definitely kid friendly). Upon getting there we had a brief wait, but were greeted and updated by their friendly staff. The food was great, the service was great, and the atmosphere was fun! We will definitely be back for more (although because of the kids we mostly order in their wings and pretzels ) Can't wait to check it out on the roof top! Oh, and did I mention how friendly everyone is?!?

I had a great time here but it had nothing to do with the bar. It's one peg up from an average sports bar, with Whiskey in the name to try and make it feel New Southern Hip. It doesn't work, but in their favor the $3.50 microbrew special ain't bad.

Not at all what I hoped this place would be. With a title like "whiskey warehouse" I was thinking of a place that would be small, quiet, and maybe even have a fireplace in the corner. But I should've known better. It's a typical loud sports bar that happens to have a wide selection of whiskey and scotch. 

That being said I'm giving it three stars because the staff was nice and the place was well kept and clean. It's just not what I expected which is more of a personal problem than a critique.

I've received great feedback about the wings at Whiskey warehouse so I placed an order for wings for my latest event. Needless to say my guests thought the wings were ok at best. There were not crunchy, actually quite soggy and I was expecting the the Jack Daniels bbq flavor to actually taste and look like bbq.
I will say the buffalo chicken dip was awesome!!! It was a hit and didn't last long. I should of ordered more dip and less wings.
I frequently visit Whiskey. Not only do I love the food but the service is amazing. Mischa always makes it point to come over and see how we're doing. Best neighborhood bar there is!!!

A great place to watch the game.

Many 60 inch HD plasmas with great sight lines about anywhere you sit.

They have the usual selection of pub grub.
The fries are better than average.

Whiskey warehouse is a great bar ANY day of the week. The drink specials are cheap and plentiful ($4 jack all most all the time) and they usually are well staffed with well trained, well mannered servers. It's in a part of Charlotte that is growing with new housing and cool bars/dives every week. The ambience is the regular sports bar with a bit more room for larger parties and sit down eating on the main level. On the second level -my personal favorite- is the patio! Equipped with plenty of tv's, lots of table top seating, bar stool options, a nice view of downtown and an added bonus is that they have bathrooms upstairs so you don't have to go up and down while having drinks. Also the bathrooms are not a run down toilet shack but really well put together. They have great food options and the wings are amazing !

I had to come here to update my review after visiting Whisky Warehouse multiple times this year for brunch and other weekend day drinking activities. My visits as of late have been awesome! The food was always good to me, it was the service that needed improving to make this place awesome and it did! I always sit at the bar when visiting and the bartenders are always attentive and sweet. Inside and at the outside patio upstairs it's been great. This is now added to my rotation of favorite brunches. Plus that amazing view...
